revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-03-14 20:27:19.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/firewall/agents/l3reference/firewall_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/firewall/agents/l3reference/test_firewall_l3_agent.py'], 'message': 'Fix KeyError except on router_info in FW Agent

The workflow of creating a firewall when a router without any i/f is present in that tenant
causes a KeyError on the FWAgent. The issue occurs as such routers are present in the list of
routers returned by get_routers() but are not populated in the router_info dict. Adding a check
before accessing the dict to prevent the exception. When an i/f is added to such routers -
_router_added processing in the l3agent will populate the router_info dict and the FWAgent
also picks this up in that context.

Change-Id: I5ea22e88a46e62372a0462e9cb958a08dd9f4c7d
Closes-Bug: #1289643
'}]
commit_message:
Fix KeyError except on router_info in FW Agent

The workflow of creating a firewall when a router without any i/f is present in that tenant
causes a KeyError on the FWAgent. The issue occurs as such routers are present in the list of
routers returned by get_routers() but are not populated in the router_info dict. Adding a check
before accessing the dict to prevent the exception. When an i/f is added to such routers -
_router_added processing in the l3agent will populate the router_info dict and the FWAgent
also picks this up in that context.

Change-Id: I5ea22e88a46e62372a0462e9cb958a08dd9f4c7d
Closes-Bug: #1289643

This reverts commit 2e7bdb872e9660178451f71b35976a980f047300.

This commit I9137e3426c82c73855ae0e50317cfd6477195318 is the second
patch that broke stable/havana by introducing a dependency on oauthlib,
but oauthlib isn't in the stable/havana branch of global dependencies
(fix in progress Ib2e2aa2e75e7b7b43e0534eeb62e748d1edc0bc3). And we use

This is the final patch in reverting bp add-oauth-support.

Commit subject was (but exceeds maximum pep8 subject length):
Revert "Add request/access token and consumer support for keystoneclient"

Fixes-Bug: #1292797

Change-Id: Ib45fb39b01ddcf5c8fc0179811efded84c0cb908
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add request/access token and consumer..."

This reverts commit 2e7bdb872e9660178451f71b35976a980f047300.

This commit I9137e3426c82c73855ae0e50317cfd6477195318 is the second
patch that broke stable/havana by introducing a dependency on oauthlib,
but oauthlib isn't in the stable/havana branch of global dependencies
(fix in progress Ib2e2aa2e75e7b7b43e0534eeb62e748d1edc0bc3). And we use
trunk clients in stable/havana gate jobs. So this patch broke both heat
and horizon, both of which import this file to support keystone's v3 API.

This is the final patch in reverting bp add-oauth-support.

Commit subject was (but exceeds maximum pep8 subject length):
Revert "Add request/access token and consumer support for keystoneclient"

Fixes-Bug: #1292797

Change-Id: Ib45fb39b01ddcf5c8fc0179811efded84c0cb908

commit_message:
Remove verbose_name from hidden fields

verbose_name is unnecessary for hidden field.
Some verbose_name does not have much meaning
(it is just a mirror of form field name), but
it is marked as translated and such strings
are difficult to translate. To address this,
this commit cleans up verbose_name of hidden fields.

Change-Id: I14fc242f90ce22abe5a0517b44968c2a98f97f48
Closes-Bug: #1291548

'metadata' column. Bringing it back. It contains useful information and should
be displayed in the table.

commit_message:
Remove aggregate_get() from conductor API

The aggregate_get() method of the conductor API is no longer used.
Remove it from the client code and leave a note on the manager side
for it to be removed in the next major version bump.

This is cleanup, but part of a blueprint being completed during
feature freeze.  It allows us to drop more code in the rpc version
bump.

Part of blueprint rpc-major-version-updates-icehouse

Change-Id: I893f58bbcae21112f186348cefcbfdd3bcbb8c06

ssh_floating.py did not worked with nova network because of the

Change-Id: I14000e97fb6a857c7c0fed126a90e7e16509d8ec

commit_message:
stress/actions/ssh_floating.py n-net compatibility

ssh_floating.py did not worked with nova network because of the
used security group specification style.

Now it is expected to work regardless neutron or n-net used for
networking.

Change-Id: I14000e97fb6a857c7c0fed126a90e7e16509d8ec

commit_message:
NSX: fix intermetting UT failure on vshield test_router_create

Logstash shows this happened twice during the past 24 hours.
Let's be proactive and see if we can mitigate the random failure
by raising the poll time.

Change-Id: Icef7de4d9fbb3da037337c607fd7642cc15e0257
Closes-bug: 1292506

Adds server inject network info extensions for the V3 API

Renames admin_actions to server inject network info as its the only
action left in the admin actions extension. This is part of blueprint
v3-admin-actions-split which allows more selective enablement
of features contained in the admin_actions extension.

Note that XML api samples are no longer generated because
bp remove-v3-xml-api has been approved.

Partially implements bp v3-api-admin-actions-split
DocImpact: Adds os-server-inject-network-info extension extension
and moves the inject-network-info functionality out of
os-admin-actions into this new extension.

Change-Id: Ie570b44813da5c04abb96e43b0be6bf7fbbcd87b

subject: Add more log info around 'Instance could not be found' error.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-19 00:19:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Add more log info around 'Instance could not be found' error.

- very rarely we get 404 response for:
    GET /${project_id}/servers/${instance_id}
inspite of the instance being active.
- current log message on nova api does not have enough info to debug
  this problem.
- hence included log.exception to print the original exception along
  with its
  traceback for debugging the reason behind the 'Instance could not be
found' 404 error.

Co-authored-by: Sridevi Koushik <sridevi.koushik@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: I86e828610c35e4ca8b270e1ac0ae2583e52fc939
Closes-Bug: #1278849
"}]
commit_message:
Add more log info around 'Instance could not be found' error.

- very rarely we get 404 response for:
    GET /${project_id}/servers/${instance_id}
inspite of the instance being active.
- current log message on nova api does not have enough info to debug
  this problem.
- hence included log.exception to print the original exception along
  with its
  traceback for debugging the reason behind the 'Instance could not be
found' 404 error.

Co-authored-by: Sridevi Koushik <sridevi.koushik@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: I86e828610c35e4ca8b270e1ac0ae2583e52fc939
Closes-Bug: #1278849

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-26 14:23:10.000000000', 'files': ['savanna/plugins/intel/installer.py', 'savanna/plugins/intel/client/client.py', 'savanna/plugins/intel/client/rest.py'], 'message': 'Make IDH work with Agent

Currently IDH client uses telnetlib to check IDH Manager availability.
That does not work with the agent, as with the agent any operation must
be proxied through the remote. The fix replaces telnet with HTTP get
checking that server returned some response.

Change-Id: Ie8854b1ca849c9be47896f5407ef5ca9bb172d76
'}]
commit_message:
Make IDH work with Agent

Currently IDH client uses telnetlib to check IDH Manager availability.
That does not work with the agent, as with the agent any operation must
be proxied through the remote. The fix replaces telnet with HTTP get
checking that server returned some response.

Change-Id: Ie8854b1ca849c9be47896f5407ef5ca9bb172d76

commit_message:
Modify RAM weigher so that it can be percentage based

Added a new flag so that hosts can be weighed regarding its percentage
of free RAM instead of using the absolute RAM values.

Implements blueprint normalize-scheduler-weights-2
DocImpact: new flag introduced

Change-Id: I020fd83bdf8d96a4a649f5830f1a9ad73edb2ffa

revisions:
[{'number': 31, 'created': '2014-03-06 09:50:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cells/weights/ram_by_instance_type.py', 'etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'doc/source/devref/filter_scheduler.rst', 'nova/scheduler/weights/ram.py', 'nova/tests/cells/test_cells_weights.py', 'nova/tests/scheduler/test_weights.py'], 'message': 'Use stacking flags instead of negative multipliers in weighers

We should use a specific flag to state that the weigher should behave
the inverse of the expected behaviour (stacking vs spreading), instead
of using a multiplier for that. A multiplier is a way to specify the
importance of a weigher against the rest of them, so specifying a
negative multiplier is counter-intuitive. Moreover, when using more
than 1 weigher, the negative multiplier may not have the effect of
stacking, since the calculated weight will be simply subtracted from
the other weights.

be backwards compatible. It will convert the negative multipliers to
positive numbers, and set the stacking flag to True.

Implements blueprint normalize-scheduler-weights-2
DocImpact: Multipliers should not be used anymore for stacking. In the
affected weighers, stacking flags have been added.
UpgradeImpact: Negative multipliers are not used anymore for stacking.
It is still possible to use them, but a deprecation warning will be
issued.

Change-Id: I64b9cce1d1de44dfa49f6418d367d63ffcc1c7a9
'}]
commit_message:
Use stacking flags instead of negative multipliers in weighers

We should use a specific flag to state that the weigher should behave
the inverse of the expected behaviour (stacking vs spreading), instead
of using a multiplier for that. A multiplier is a way to specify the
importance of a weigher against the rest of them, so specifying a
negative multiplier is counter-intuitive. Moreover, when using more
than 1 weigher, the negative multiplier may not have the effect of
stacking, since the calculated weight will be simply subtracted from
the other weights.

This change will also allow the usage of negative multipliers, so as to
be backwards compatible. It will convert the negative multipliers to
positive numbers, and set the stacking flag to True.

Implements blueprint normalize-scheduler-weights-2
DocImpact: Multipliers should not be used anymore for stacking. In the
affected weighers, stacking flags have been added.
UpgradeImpact: Negative multipliers are not used anymore for stacking.
It is still possible to use them, but a deprecation warning will be
issued.

Change-Id: I64b9cce1d1de44dfa49f6418d367d63ffcc1c7a9

subject: VMware: Move SOAP response fault checking outside try block
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-03 15:10:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vim.py'], 'message': "VMware: Move SOAP response fault checking outside try block

Fault checking checks the response of an apparently successful SOAP
call to see if it contains an error. It doesn't make any SOAP calls
itself, so it doesn't need the large block of error checking below. It
can throw a VimFaultException, though, which looks sufficiently weird
in this place to have warranted a comment.

This change is simple code motion. Fault checking moves outside the
block. This means that the large exception handling block doesn't need
to handle its VimFaultException. The moved code block no longer needs
to catch VimFaultException as it will propagate automatically.

Change-Id: I24eabd661cbe23819da04830da5ad11afc7aed45
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: Move SOAP response fault checking outside try block

Fault checking checks the response of an apparently successful SOAP
call to see if it contains an error. It doesn't make any SOAP calls
itself, so it doesn't need the large block of error checking below. It
can throw a VimFaultException, though, which looks sufficiently weird
in this place to have warranted a comment.

This change is simple code motion. Fault checking moves outside the
block. This means that the large exception handling block doesn't need
to handle its VimFaultException. The moved code block no longer needs
to catch VimFaultException as it will propagate automatically.

Change-Id: I24eabd661cbe23819da04830da5ad11afc7aed45

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-07 21:50:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/volumeops.py'], 'message': 'Fix volume attach on non-standard vmdks

The volumeops._attach_volume_vmdk was looking up hardware devices
for the wrong VM.  It needs to look up properties on the VM
representing the volume, not the VM to attach to.  It works today
only in cases where the vmdk matches the defaults the code falls
back to.

Change-Id: Ied88fd9219ffbd1cb2ceca0224d1bef236fbcb9f
Closes-bug: #1255317
'}]
commit_message:
Fix volume attach on non-standard vmdks

The volumeops._attach_volume_vmdk was looking up hardware devices
for the wrong VM.  It needs to look up properties on the VM
representing the volume, not the VM to attach to.  It works today
only in cases where the vmdk matches the defaults the code falls
back to.

Change-Id: Ied88fd9219ffbd1cb2ceca0224d1bef236fbcb9f
Closes-bug: #1255317

commit_message:
Make the image api more useful

- remove glance_id from the plan (a component will be used instead)
- add base_image_id, created_image_id & image_format to the image
- add source_format to the image
- choose the script path based on the image and source format
- pass the base image uuid into the build scipt

Change-Id: I89c01e84b0e38460c3a39ed7c9a3de22a0df49db

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-14 01:28:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/api.py'], 'message': 'Move log statement to expose actually info_cache value

When debugging an info_cache issue I noticed the logs  display:

"Updating cache with info: None update_instance_cache_with_nw_info"

Though we are not actually updating the info_cache with None as if
nw_info is not isinstance(NetworkInfo we fetch the latest nw_info
from neturon. This patch just moves the log statement so the actual
value is exposed.

Change-Id: I3a74191c31a053682bb2558c59228025ceb0cf28
Closes-bug: 1292298
'}]
commit_message:
Move log statement to expose actually info_cache value

When debugging an info_cache issue I noticed the logs  display:

"Updating cache with info: None update_instance_cache_with_nw_info"

Though we are not actually updating the info_cache with None as if
nw_info is not isinstance(NetworkInfo we fetch the latest nw_info
from neturon. This patch just moves the log statement so the actual
value is exposed.

Change-Id: I3a74191c31a053682bb2558c59228025ceb0cf28
Closes-bug: 1292298

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-15 00:25:03.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/v3/test_oauth1.py', 'keystoneclient/auth/identity/v3.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Authenticate via oauth"

This reverts commit 149e1128818aacb24654f990430791562054fa93.

This commit I958983f505e261e3f1920a8df66eced3258b001e broke
stable/havana by introducing a dependency on oauthlib, but oauthlib
isn't in the stable/havana branch of global dependencies (fix in
progress Ib2e2aa2e75e7b7b43e0534eeb62e748d1edc0bc3). And we use trunk
clients in stable/havana gate jobs. So this patch broke both heat and
horizon, both of which import this file to support keystone's v3 API.

Change-Id: I56f7a8d2d2ddce0565f29bf29628555e4fe3c761
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Authenticate via oauth"

This reverts commit 149e1128818aacb24654f990430791562054fa93.

This commit I958983f505e261e3f1920a8df66eced3258b001e broke
stable/havana by introducing a dependency on oauthlib, but oauthlib
isn't in the stable/havana branch of global dependencies (fix in
progress Ib2e2aa2e75e7b7b43e0534eeb62e748d1edc0bc3). And we use trunk
clients in stable/havana gate jobs. So this patch broke both heat and
horizon, both of which import this file to support keystone's v3 API.

Change-Id: I56f7a8d2d2ddce0565f29bf29628555e4fe3c761

subject: Fix equal_any() DB API helper
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-14 17:40:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Fix equal_any() DB API helper

equal_any() query helper is meant to produce a WHERE clause combining
a few conditions with OR operator in order to select the rows for
which the given column is equal to ANY of passed values. In fact,
it uses AND operator instead of OR, which means that an incorrect
WHERE clause will be returned, if more than one value is passed to
equal_any().

This is caused by the fact that the or_() function from SQLAlchemy
expression language is used incorrectly: it accepts unpacked
instances of BinaryExpression, but a list of ones is passed.
Unfortunately, in 0.7.x and 0.8.x branches of SQLAlchemy passing
a list of values to or_() won't raise an exception immidiately,
and the result will be an iterable, which explains why we didn't
see equal_any() was actually broken before. Besides, equal_any() is
rarely used in our code base and the test didn't cover the case when
more than 1 value is passed to the function.

This effectively fixes the error when running Nova unit tests
with SQLAlchemy 0.9.x releases.

Closes-Bug: #1292285

Change-Id: If4c0f1d3e016e2affb0d49293c62ca9df0d033f7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix equal_any() DB API helper

equal_any() query helper is meant to produce a WHERE clause combining
a few conditions with OR operator in order to select the rows for
which the given column is equal to ANY of passed values. In fact,
it uses AND operator instead of OR, which means that an incorrect
WHERE clause will be returned, if more than one value is passed to
equal_any().

This is caused by the fact that the or_() function from SQLAlchemy
expression language is used incorrectly: it accepts unpacked
instances of BinaryExpression, but a list of ones is passed.
Unfortunately, in 0.7.x and 0.8.x branches of SQLAlchemy passing
a list of values to or_() won't raise an exception immidiately,
and the result will be an iterable, which explains why we didn't
see equal_any() was actually broken before. Besides, equal_any() is
rarely used in our code base and the test didn't cover the case when
more than 1 value is passed to the function.

This effectively fixes the error when running Nova unit tests
with SQLAlchemy 0.9.x releases.

Closes-Bug: #1292285

Change-Id: If4c0f1d3e016e2affb0d49293c62ca9df0d033f7

commit_message:
Improve Datastore Not Implemented exceptions

Added exception for not implemented exceptions
that indicates the operation name.
Added missing un-implemented methods to redis.
Change handling of remote errors from guest agent
api to only pass along the root exception message
rather than the full traceback

Change-Id: I0d4fdc5340bfb40370595636cc57cc5c87889507
Closes-Bug: #1276860

commit_message:
Fix account quota mw for handling a bad source path

The copy source must be container/object.
This patch avoids the server to return
an internal server error when user provides
a path without a container.

Change-Id: I8ea4e62b2a00c4b4a1666d30411a6c93a4f848a5
Fixes: bug #1254626

The test for expect header being sent
with non-zero object PUTs doesn't seem
to check its results, so passes whether
the expect header is set or not.

Change-Id: Ic74233c19e48aba43e63501467565e305ed399c3

commit_message:
Fix ml2 & nec plugins for allowedaddresspairs tests

Enabling the allowedaddresspairs tests uncovered that update_port()
was not returning the expected updated port info (still contained
original info).

Closes-bug: #1255150

commit_message:
Enable pep8 tests for the Nova Ironic Driver

Enable pep8 tests for the Nova Ironic Driver and fix the current pep8
errors. Being able to run pep8 tests against the driver helps the
development because it captures problems like syntax errors, unbound
variables, duplicated methods, etc...

Change-Id: If1da455bb8669b56267cb3ecf45369d5d83a86b7

subject: Remove OpenStack log in favor of native logging
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-14 21:59:26.000000000', 'files': ['barbicanclient/openstack/common/log.py', 'barbicanclient/common/config.py', 'openstack-common.conf', 'barbicanclient/verifications.py', 'barbicanclient/barbican.py'], 'message': 'Remove OpenStack log in favor of native logging

Openstack log prevents the client from being loaded due to arg parsing.
Since native logging is used everywhere else, it makes sense to remove
it completely.

All other projects seem to do the same thing as well.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Lee <rblee88@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I42a4532e614aa465d9421139b8e8bddf2ba01072
'}]
commit_message:
Remove OpenStack log in favor of native logging

Openstack log prevents the client from being loaded due to arg parsing.
Since native logging is used everywhere else, it makes sense to remove
it completely.

All other projects seem to do the same thing as well.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Lee <rblee88@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I42a4532e614aa465d9421139b8e8bddf2ba01072

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 7139, 'name': 'Zhi Kun Liu', 'username': 'zhikunliu', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 7808, 'name': 'Xavier Queralt', 'email': 'xqueralt@gmail.com', 'username': 'xqueralt'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-11 14:59:07.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_volume_boot_pattern.py'], 'message': 'Unset the imageRef when booting from volume

When testing boot from volume, we were passing the image_ref no matter
what to servers.create. This will cause nova to use the metadata from
that image instead of the one that might contain the volume.

This patch sets the image to an empty string, which is the same
behaviour the nova CLI has when booting from a volume.

Change-Id: I59bd4e2be6d6fff782dd278390ad5241cd09e3df
'}]
commit_message:
Unset the imageRef when booting from volume

When testing boot from volume, we were passing the image_ref no matter
what to servers.create. This will cause nova to use the metadata from
that image instead of the one that might contain the volume.

This patch sets the image to an empty string, which is the same
behaviour the nova CLI has when booting from a volume.

Change-Id: I59bd4e2be6d6fff782dd278390ad5241cd09e3df

commit_message:
Ensure name is utf-8 when deleting rbd vol or snap

If the name supplied to librbd is not utf-8 e.g. unicode,
an exception is raised. This was previously fixed and
subsequently broken by commit cbe1d5f.

Change-Id: I29f5e9db87ceb5f9cfe3be43e76d3e860edaf6d7
Closes-Bug: bug 1292433

commit_message:
Fixes bug with keypair creating

If try create several shares with share-network that does not have
service vm yet, all threads tries create it, and after race condition
only first successful, other fails.

Closes-bug: 1292704

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-06 15:28:36.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/neutron_keystone_auth_spec.rb', 'manifests/keystone/auth.pp'], 'message': 'add parameter for endpoint protocols

commit_message:
Add support for copy offload, E-Series driver

This change adds support in puppet-cinder for the Cinder driver for
NetApp's E-Series storage solutions. It also includes support for the
new copy offload function. Both of these functions were introduced in
the Icehouse release.

Change-Id: I8a718ba19bcf9f558ddf6c96d7f19f2cf8c3e608
Closes-Bug: 1289032

subject: Don't sync [system_]metadata down to cells on instance.save()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7494, 'name': 'Guangya Liu', 'email': 'gyliu513@gmail.com', 'username': 'JayLau'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-13 20:07:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/cells/test_cells_messaging.py', 'nova/cells/messaging.py'], 'message': "Don't sync [system_]metadata down to cells on instance.save()

A cell should be authoritative for its metadata and system_metadata.
rebuild relis on system_metadata not being updated until the cell
updates it itself.  update_instance_metadata relies on metadata not
being updated so that it can calculate the diff properly.

And before the objects conversion took place the compute.api.update()
method that instance.save() replaced was not used for syncing metadata
or system_metadata.  So this change goes back to previous behaviour for
cells.

Change-Id: I339da9d1ff6d0e59f6a4ab68fd396bdfca7a224b
Closes-bug: #1292181
Closes-bug: #1292185
"}]
commit_message:
Don't sync [system_]metadata down to cells on instance.save()

A cell should be authoritative for its metadata and system_metadata.
rebuild relis on system_metadata not being updated until the cell
updates it itself.  update_instance_metadata relies on metadata not
being updated so that it can calculate the diff properly.

And before the objects conversion took place the compute.api.update()
method that instance.save() replaced was not used for syncing metadata
or system_metadata.  So this change goes back to previous behaviour for
cells.

Change-Id: I339da9d1ff6d0e59f6a4ab68fd396bdfca7a224b
Closes-bug: #1292181
Closes-bug: #1292185

commit_message:
Add security_group_rule to objects registry

This adds the security_group_rule module to the objects registry,
which allows a service to make sure that all of its objects are
registered before any could be received over RPC.

We don't really have a test for any of these because of the nature
of how they're imported. Refactoring this later could provide some
incremental steps to making this more testable.

Change-Id: Ie96021f3cdeac6addab21c42a14cd8f136eb0b27
Closes-Bug: #1264816

the fdb_remove rpc message is sent when the status

commit_message:
Send fdb remove message when a port is migrated

the fdb_remove rpc message is sent when the status
of the port goes to BUILD, that is when the new host
send a get_device_details which means that it owns
the migrated port. The fdb_add message will be sent
as soon as the new host send update_device_up

Closes bug: #1237841

Change-Id: Ibdc7768d8db922b7e6eb9dc505382168cbb8e55d

commit_message:
Add Wait Condition to Block Storage Templates

In some environments the heat stack-create command would complete
even though the block storage node would still be in a
build/spawning state.  This patch adds a wait condition to ensure
the block storage node has a chance to complete and the stack-create
command to complete properly.

Change-Id: Idb524625b8d6df1ff6f927c22b72bc6d3d611686
Partial-Bug: #1290764

This patch adds a new paramter to the rabbitmq class

commit_message:
Add support for latest puppetlabs-rabbitmq

(Patch related (copy/paste) to http://git.io/T9zQHg from Michael)

This patch adds a new paramter to the rabbitmq class
that allows a user to specify the class name. This allows
selection of 'rabbitmq::server' - the old name, or 'rabbitmq' -
the new name changed during the recent rewrite of the
puppetlabs-rabbitmq module.

Change-Id: I3dfb05456caf7af6b00b58ab86d413d4d3b85c5e

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-12 17:36:04.000000000', 'files': ['functions'], 'message': 'fix failing wget statements under -o errexit in vmdk upload routine

Fix the case when uploaded image has no descriptor.
Refactored the code a bit

Tested:
1. monithic Sparse
2. monolithic flat
    2.1 flat file name mentioned in descriptor file
    2.1 flat file name not mentioned in descriptor file
3. descriptor header not found in the file
    3.1 image file name is *-flat, download descriptor
    3.2 image file name does not end with *-flat
4. file name contains all image properties

Change-Id: I0df9be5c2a1b9ed53cdb22d5cd40b94e56c48f37
Closes-bug: #1289664
'}]
commit_message:
fix failing wget statements under -o errexit in vmdk upload routine

Fix the case when uploaded image has no descriptor.
Refactored the code a bit

Tested:
1. monithic Sparse
2. monolithic flat
    2.1 flat file name mentioned in descriptor file
    2.1 flat file name not mentioned in descriptor file
3. descriptor header not found in the file
    3.1 image file name is *-flat, download descriptor
    3.2 image file name does not end with *-flat
4. file name contains all image properties

Change-Id: I0df9be5c2a1b9ed53cdb22d5cd40b94e56c48f37
Closes-bug: #1289664

commit_message:
Improve Datastore Not Implemented exceptions

Implemented a base class for managers to simplify
handling of un-implemented methods
Added exception for not implemented exceptions
that indicates the operation name.
Change handling of remote errors from guest agent
api to only pass along the root exception message
rather than the full traceback

Change-Id: Id7b1f3a68e91f74f7ff741be77058c9ce627bce4
Closes-Bug: #1276860

subject: Avoid calling callbacks while holding locks
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-13 01:26:48.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/worker_based/cache.py'], 'message': 'Avoid calling callbacks while holding locks

Instead of calling the callback while holding
a write lock (a recipe for deadlock) call the
callbacks after we pop all the values to avoid
any potential for deadlock.

Change-Id: Idb4275d8f07d60e2ed83c0987b6c7354a09c8a71
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid calling callbacks while holding locks

Instead of calling the callback while holding
a write lock (a recipe for deadlock) call the
callbacks after we pop all the values to avoid
any potential for deadlock.

commit_message:
Added endpoint for binding identity services.

This changes adds an endpoint that is used to specify a bind_interface
or host to bind the indentity services to.

The following change in the identity cookbook is dependent on this one:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/78019/

blueprint increase-ip-binding-flexibility

Change-Id: I12798ebcee0eb5b226a51d7824fbb172c50fdf37

subject: Handle Ceph-related steps for using the RBD store
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-11 15:59:50.000000000', 'files': ['spec/spec_helper.rb', 'attributes/default.rb', 'spec/api_spec.rb', 'recipes/api.rb', 'README.md'], 'message': "Handle Ceph-related steps for using the RBD store

With this change, the api recipe will take care of the ceph-related
things when the default_store attribute is set to rbd:

- install dependency packages as specified in
  openstack[image][platform][ceph_packages]
- create a cephx client keyring file with openstack-common's template
  and the key found in the data bag specified by the newly introduced
  attribute openstack[image][api][rbd][key_name]

Change-Id: I92881e5a27fb5ec56d4f1fb72933749a3e8d8688
"}]
commit_message:
Handle Ceph-related steps for using the RBD store

With this change, the api recipe will take care of the ceph-related
things when the default_store attribute is set to rbd:

- install dependency packages as specified in
  openstack[image][platform][ceph_packages]
- create a cephx client keyring file with openstack-common's template
  and the key found in the data bag specified by the newly introduced
  attribute openstack[image][api][rbd][key_name]

Change-Id: I92881e5a27fb5ec56d4f1fb72933749a3e8d8688

commit_message:
Allow actions to be taken on paginated items

When pagination is enabled and user navigates to other pages using
"more", user is no longer able to take actions (such as delete) on the
paginated items. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I29044584a617d747ff18c7e396f4eb72e1ddfe92
Closes-Bug: #1282791

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-10 20:25:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/scheduler/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/scheduler/manager.py', 'nova/scheduler/rpcapi.py', 'nova/tests/scheduler/test_scheduler.py'], 'message': "Add version 3.0 of scheduler rpc interface

This commit adds a new major revision to the rpc interface used to
talk to the scheduler service.  The old version will be retained in
Icehouse for Havana rolling upgrade capability.  2.x can be dropped
as soon as Juno development opens.

When 2.x gets dropped, we will be able to remove the following methods
from the scheduler manager, as well as all other supporting code for
these methods throughout the scheduler:

  - create_volume()
  - live_migration()
  - show_host_resources()
  - get_backdoor_port()
  - select_hosts()

We can also drop backwards compatibility handling for the absence of
any parameters added to other methods during 2.x.

Note that the client side will only send 3.0 messages, but that's
fine.  We expect the nova-scheduler service to get updated at the same
time as, or before anything that uses this client code.

Part of blueprint rpc-major-version-updates-icehouse

Change-Id: Icca32ff1defbab06f9e9cd726b3ffa25d9fedf1e
"}]
commit_message:
Add version 3.0 of scheduler rpc interface

This commit adds a new major revision to the rpc interface used to
talk to the scheduler service.  The old version will be retained in
Icehouse for Havana rolling upgrade capability.  2.x can be dropped
as soon as Juno development opens.

When 2.x gets dropped, we will be able to remove the following methods
from the scheduler manager, as well as all other supporting code for
these methods throughout the scheduler:

  - create_volume()
  - live_migration()
  - show_host_resources()
  - get_backdoor_port()
  - select_hosts()

We can also drop backwards compatibility handling for the absence of
any parameters added to other methods during 2.x.

Note that the client side will only send 3.0 messages, but that's
fine.  We expect the nova-scheduler service to get updated at the same
time as, or before anything that uses this client code.

Part of blueprint rpc-major-version-updates-icehouse

Change-Id: Icca32ff1defbab06f9e9cd726b3ffa25d9fedf1e

commit_message:
Enable to select specific network service type

Network service type is selected as 'network' statically.
This will select the service_type from environment variables or CLI options.
The option works like the service type option in the novaclient.

Implements blueprint specify-service-type
Change-Id: If21bd2b5cb35da5bcabca79aa0567870331a3a6f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-06 14:44:03.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Python3: fix test_stack_list_with_args()

The expected_url in test_stack_list_with_args() does not always match the URL
actually used in the code. This patch fixes this issue by:
- using urlutils.urlencode() in both the code and the tests, so that changes in
 the urlencode() implementation do not affect the tests;
- setting the PYTHONHASHSEED environment variable to 0 when running the tests,
  so that randomisation is disabled and urlutils.urlencode() has predictable
  results.

Change-Id: I5b50bad98f5c237cdc12e4ab75f21917ca0ef30d
'}]
commit_message:
Python3: fix test_stack_list_with_args()

The expected_url in test_stack_list_with_args() does not always match the URL
actually used in the code. This patch fixes this issue by:
- using urlutils.urlencode() in both the code and the tests, so that changes in
 the urlencode() implementation do not affect the tests;
- setting the PYTHONHASHSEED environment variable to 0 when running the tests,
  so that randomisation is disabled and urlutils.urlencode() has predictable
  results.

Change-Id: I5b50bad98f5c237cdc12e4ab75f21917ca0ef30d

commit_message:
Fixing ordering bugs in workbook model and tests

* When parsing yaml we can't rely on order of properties
 because it's against yaml specification
* In tests we often make assumptions about list items order

Change-Id: I536bc31ba7bee68e2904a23af73004f2e0ba2261

To make it easier to do async operations as the result

Change-Id: I013224b096cb90a2d18c4ac9f1d7b07fdda63166
'}]
commit_message:
Allow tasks to return futures

To make it easier to do async operations as the result
of tasks (this is not so useful to do in the remote worker
model) allow for tasks returning futures and extracting the
value of that future only when it is needed.

Change-Id: I013224b096cb90a2d18c4ac9f1d7b07fdda63166

RHEL Package maps for build-essential, python-dev and libz-dev.

Some of the tripleo-image-elements were failing for RHEL due to lack of
build essential, python-dev and libz-dev.

This commit should fix those failure.

subject: Heat/Horizon/Tempest: don't hard code venv dir
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-03-14 00:19:55.000000000', 'files': ['elements/horizon/files/horizon.conf', 'elements/horizon/os-apply-config/etc/horizon/local_settings.py', 'elements/heat-engine/install.d/heat-source-install/10-heat-engine', 'elements/tempest/environment.d/10-tempest-venv-dir.bash', 'elements/tempest/bin/run-tempest', 'elements/horizon/install.d/horizon-source-install/100-horizon', 'elements/heat/environment.d/10-heat-venv-dir.bash', 'elements/horizon/environment.d/10-horizon-venv-dir.bash', 'elements/horizon/os-refresh-config/environment.d/10-horizon-venv-dir.bash', 'elements/horizon/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/100-horizon', 'elements/tempest/install.d/51-tempest'], 'message': "Heat/Horizon/Tempest: don't hard code venv dir

Updates the heat/horizon/tempest elements so that we use a new
{SERVICE}_VENV_DIR variable (set via an environment.d hook)
to configure the virtualenv directory.

For the Horizon element the HTTP config file was moved into
the install.d directory so that we can perform an inline
in element replacement on the HORIZON_VENV_DIR. This file was already
static so this should have no effect on its use today.

For Horizon's local_settings.py we have the tempate render itself
to /etc/horizon/local_settings.py and then copy it via
os-refresh-configs post-configure to the final $HORIZON_VENV_DIR.

For the Tempest element we soft link testr into the $PATH so
as to avoid a hard coded path to the venv dir in the run-tempest
bin file.

This is cleaner in that we aren't hard coding /opt/stack/venv
everywhere and also supports both isolated and shared
venvs (which some people would like to use).

Change-Id: I6cf282dc8d8fd806d8dd0bdb21d5afb93243bd3f
"}]
commit_message:
Heat/Horizon/Tempest: don't hard code venv dir

Updates the heat/horizon/tempest elements so that we use a new
{SERVICE}_VENV_DIR variable (set via an environment.d hook)
to configure the virtualenv directory.

For the Horizon element the HTTP config file was moved into
the install.d directory so that we can perform an inline
in element replacement on the HORIZON_VENV_DIR. This file was already
static so this should have no effect on its use today.

For Horizon's local_settings.py we have the tempate render itself
to /etc/horizon/local_settings.py and then copy it via
os-refresh-configs post-configure to the final $HORIZON_VENV_DIR.

For the Tempest element we soft link testr into the $PATH so
as to avoid a hard coded path to the venv dir in the run-tempest
bin file.

This is cleaner in that we aren't hard coding /opt/stack/venv
everywhere and also supports both isolated and shared
venvs (which some people would like to use).

Change-Id: I6cf282dc8d8fd806d8dd0bdb21d5afb93243bd3f

commit_message:
Swap the saharaclient and savannaclient directories

Exchange the contents of the saharaclient and savannaclient directories
so that 'savannlient' is the effective alias and 'saharaclient' contains
all of the source code.

* Change all of the imports that reference savannaclient to saharaclient
* Change paths that reference savannaclient (under doc)
* Leave variable and class names unchaned at this point
* Leave references to python_savannaclient unchanged since the top
* level dir name has not yet changed

Partial-implements: blueprint savanna-renaming-client
Change-Id: I83cb21922ae5a8cec291990b3ab67bb9e3cb2d62

Oslo commit b5cca99e5281d9c0c5eda444137e418b31209c45 removed

in tools/install_venv.py .  The post_process function was just

commit_message:
Remove call to undefined install.post_process()

Oslo commit b5cca99e5281d9c0c5eda444137e418b31209c45 removed
the obsolete redhat-eventlet.patch.  Part of this commit
removed the post_process() method which we were still calling
in tools/install_venv.py .  The post_process function was just
there to do any distro-specific post processing.  By default,
that was nothing.  So, this is safe to remove.

This same change was made to python-novaclient with
commit 0194492059920fd8d9d91849c341b2de0b561089 .

Closes-bug: 1275025
Change-Id: I4c52e2c0d3d6553f5d33e94cd6e8622160febc37

subject: Add ability to specify IP for service
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-03-10 17:42:16.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/postgresql-server.rb', 'recipes/mysql-server.rb', 'attributes/default.rb', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Add ability to specify IP for service

The problem that this change addresses is that the address_for method
will not work correctly if there are multiple IP address associated
with the specified interface.

The approach to solving this problem and moving towards the overall
goal of having one place where service networking information is
stored is to convert address_for calls into endpoints, and add a
address() method to the endpoints interface for IP address resolution.

The address() method has the following behavior: if the
bind_interface of an endpoint is set, then the IP is looked up on
the interface.  Otherwise, the IP specified in the host attribute is
returned.  This allows the caller to choose either method of
determining what IP a service will be bound to.

This initial change switches both the openstack-ops-database and
openstack-ops-messaging cookbooks over to use endpoints instead of
address_for.  The other cookbooks will be switched over time.

blueprint increase-ip-binding-flexibility

Change-Id: I2d1c40ec79a2533be150c5b4ea6e1f396c500e9d
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to specify IP for service

The problem that this change addresses is that the address_for method
will not work correctly if there are multiple IP address associated
with the specified interface.

The approach to solving this problem and moving towards the overall
goal of having one place where service networking information is
stored is to convert address_for calls into endpoints, and add a
address() method to the endpoints interface for IP address resolution.

The address() method has the following behavior: if the
bind_interface of an endpoint is set, then the IP is looked up on
the interface.  Otherwise, the IP specified in the host attribute is
returned.  This allows the caller to choose either method of
determining what IP a service will be bound to.

This initial change switches both the openstack-ops-database and
openstack-ops-messaging cookbooks over to use endpoints instead of
address_for.  The other cookbooks will be switched over time.

blueprint increase-ip-binding-flexibility

Change-Id: I2d1c40ec79a2533be150c5b4ea6e1f396c500e9d

commit_message:
Makes possible to enable Registry API v1 and v2

This change will make possible to enable/disable both v1 and v2 Registry APIs
either individually or together from glance-registry.conf.

DocImpact

commit_message:
Add keypair context

This was previously part of the security group context but doesn't
strictly fit there. This context provides a clean single purpose way of
providing ssh keys for temporary users.

subject: get volumes with limit and filters does not work
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-11 19:24:42.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/api/v1/test_volumes.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v2/stubs.py', 'cinder/db/api.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py', 'cinder/tests/test_db_api.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': 'get volumes with limit and filters does not work

The /volumes and /volumes/detail REST APIs support filtering. Currently,
all filtering is done after the volumes are retrieved from the database
in the API.get_all function in /cinder/volume/api.py. Therefore, the usage
combination of filters and limit will only work if all volumes matching
the filters are in the page of data being retrieved from the database.

For example, assume that all of the volumes with a name of "foo" would be
retrieved from the database starting at index 100 and that you query for
all volumes with a name of "foo" while specifying a limit of 50.  In this
case, the query would yield 0 results since the filter did not match any of
the first 50 entries retrieved from the database.

This patch removes all filtering from the volume API layer and moves it
into the DB layer.

Test cases were added to verify filtering at the DB level.

Change-Id: Ia084e1f4cf59ea39bf8a0a36686146a315168cbb
Closes-bug: 1287813
'}]
commit_message:
get volumes with limit and filters does not work

The /volumes and /volumes/detail REST APIs support filtering. Currently,
all filtering is done after the volumes are retrieved from the database
in the API.get_all function in /cinder/volume/api.py. Therefore, the usage
combination of filters and limit will only work if all volumes matching
the filters are in the page of data being retrieved from the database.

For example, assume that all of the volumes with a name of "foo" would be
retrieved from the database starting at index 100 and that you query for
all volumes with a name of "foo" while specifying a limit of 50.  In this
case, the query would yield 0 results since the filter did not match any of
the first 50 entries retrieved from the database.

This patch removes all filtering from the volume API layer and moves it
into the DB layer.

Test cases were added to verify filtering at the DB level.

Change-Id: Ia084e1f4cf59ea39bf8a0a36686146a315168cbb
Closes-bug: 1287813

commit_message:
VMware ESX: Boot from volume must not relocate vol

ESX does not support relocate API. Moreover when working with ESX the boot
from volume logic need not perform relocation since the volume's datastore
is always visible to the ESX host.

The fix is to ignore relocation when working with ESX.

Change-Id: I227cf2ea5b6f681150ede0bf6257eb238f1452d2
Closes-bug: #1244918

commit_message:
cleanup resources in setUpClass if exception raised

Resources created would not be cleanup if exception raised
in setUpClass.

This patch adds a new decorator to wrap setUpClass for
catching the exception in setUpClass and cleanup resources
using tearDownClass().

Use the decorator in the following test classes:
FloatingIPsTestJSON
ImagesMetadataTestJSON
ListServerFiltersTestJSON

Change-Id: Ia20ebd2a5d1b5ecbd5e8b21e51e7c2ee4c99fbd5
Closes-Bug: #1285509

subject: Fix input validation for V2 API server group API extension
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-03-13 23:51:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/server_groups.py', 'nova/api/openstack/common.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_server_groups.py'], 'message': 'Fix input validation for V2 API server group API extension

The server group extension create method allows the name
parameter to not be a string. The unittest which tests that an integer
passed as the name fails, but this is due to the policies parameter
missing from the test data, not because the name is invalid.

The internal nova code silently converts floats, integers, etc to strings
and so also does not pick up the validation issue.

The patch adds extra input validation to the API layer to pick up this issue
and also tightens the acceptable values of the string to reject trailing
or leading whitespace which if used can cause confusion for users. It uses
the regexp that the other parts of the API are converging towards to use
as a common acceptable name across the API rather than having different
criteria for names for different extensions.

Also ensures input validation is always properly applied to the policies
parameter and adds test cases. This part is backported from this
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/79312/5 patch.

The patch also fixes the broken unittests and adds new ones to test the
tightened criteria for the name parameter.

+DocImpact
Co-authored-by: Gary Kotton <gkotton@vmware.com>
Closes-Bug: 1290326

Change-Id: I9ddaef8a128ac6a1a448e47d6b3c9abcf719eb76
'}]
commit_message:
Fix input validation for V2 API server group API extension

The server group extension create method allows the name
parameter to not be a string. The unittest which tests that an integer
passed as the name fails, but this is due to the policies parameter
missing from the test data, not because the name is invalid.

The internal nova code silently converts floats, integers, etc to strings
and so also does not pick up the validation issue.

The patch adds extra input validation to the API layer to pick up this issue
and also tightens the acceptable values of the string to reject trailing
or leading whitespace which if used can cause confusion for users. It uses
the regexp that the other parts of the API are converging towards to use
as a common acceptable name across the API rather than having different
criteria for names for different extensions.

Also ensures input validation is always properly applied to the policies
parameter and adds test cases. This part is backported from this
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/79312/5 patch.

The patch also fixes the broken unittests and adds new ones to test the
tightened criteria for the name parameter.

+DocImpact
Co-authored-by: Gary Kotton <gkotton@vmware.com>
Closes-Bug: 1290326

Change-Id: I9ddaef8a128ac6a1a448e47d6b3c9abcf719eb76

commit_message:
Use six.add_metaclass instead of __metaclass__

Python3.x changed the way __metaclass__ are created
and six provides a utility function that can be used
to make both ways work. Lets use it instead.

Change-Id: I7a204dda97c2717c3a4ccf04f2c863efa6a7203b

subject: Remove folder .tx from git tree
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-12 06:37:06.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', '.tx/config'], 'message': 'Remove folder .tx from git tree

Folder .tx is used to save the configuration of Transifex Client.
Tracking .tx by git will cause an error while running the script:
propose_translation_update_manuals.sh
Folder .tx could be created on the fly.
So this patch removed folder .tx from git tree.

Change-Id: I582a11efc330abd3d263e1563d1ebed3fd42f974
'}]
commit_message:
Remove folder .tx from git tree

Folder .tx is used to save the configuration of Transifex Client.
Tracking .tx by git will cause an error while running the script:
propose_translation_update_manuals.sh
Folder .tx could be created on the fly.
So this patch removed folder .tx from git tree.

Change-Id: I582a11efc330abd3d263e1563d1ebed3fd42f974

commit_message:
Add Search and Category side panels

This patch adds two right side floating panels.
By default panels are hidden and only small
right side toggle buttons are visible. When user
click the side button a corresponding panel
will show up.
Right now this only UI part CSS\html part
is covered. There should be a handler for them
in django code.

Also fix issues with images. URL now point to
correct image handler.

Partially implements: blueprint app-catalog-ui
Change-Id: Ia8e4b06bf7f0b6d6a64bcd9be4f9bbbc4b0824a3

commit_message:
Add per API call statistics

This patch adds a new decorator which calls a stats
collection code to collect usage information per tenant

StatisticsCollection class is added a a stats storage.

Add hostname to stats

As Murano has multi-service deployment it is
necessary to add hostname to each stats
in order to understand which API service
provides them.

Add DB model for stats

This patch adds a new DB model to keep API stats in the DB.
As it is possible to have multiple Murano API servers
we will keep stats for each Murano API instance

Fix stats update to save data to DB

Fixed issues with column names
Added logic to calculate request\sec
and errors\sec based on previous values

Change-Id: Id5c3cdc90700563aff881e5831285a1330a2c034
Partly-Implements: blueprint api-request-stats

commit_message:
Add Statistics Collection loop

This patch adds a new service which provides
an endless loop to update statistics information.
There is no actual code for stats themselves.

the intension is to save a collected stats to DB
on a periodic basis.

Change-Id: Ia00a5068c2f744b0318a523860ccc5eba225868e
Partly-Implements: blueprint api-request-stats

commit_message:
Remove folder .tx from git tree

Tracking .tx by git will cause an error while running the script:
propose_translation_update_manuals.sh
Folder .tx could be created on the fly.
So this patch removed folder .tx from git tree.

Same as openstack-manuals
See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/79859/

Change-Id: I444f6ce3faf9559896c01652b9041619ffa17b81

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-08 15:32:05.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/fake_container_forwarding_http.py', 'swift/common/http_utils.py', 'setup.cfg', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'test/functional/tests_fake_container_forwarding_http.py', 'swift/proxy/server.py', 'swift/common/bufferedhttp.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': 'middleware & proxy-server share http code

Container_forwarding middleware needs to send requests to another proxy
instead of the usual backend servers: new module common/http_utils.py
provides such functionality.  Code is close to existing helper methods
in proxy/ob.py and proxy/base.py to minimize functionality change.
Methods in those two proxy modules can be replaced by the code in http_utils

Main changes:
- server.py: shows how proxy-server calls back container_forwarding middleware,
if present, to give it a handle on the newly created Controller object
- base.py: _make_app_iter commented out + call to new method in http_utils.py
- obj.py: send_file and chunk of PUT code commented out + call to new method
in http_utils.py
- buffered_http.py: only add device/partition to the path if they are set.
container_forwarding needs to forward the request to target proxy with the same

- http_utils.py: helper methods to connect to endpoints and forward data
to/from such connected endpoint
- fake middleware: introduces method forward_request() that is used by
the real container_forwarding middleware. This method relies on http_utils
This middleware is for helping the review process only and will not be part
of the final patch. Its basic functionality is to forward all requests to a
configured target cluster.
- functional test: simple tests for the fake middleware, testing basic

Implements: blueprint cluster-federation

Change-Id: I98960c244048157d49174adca58ee5d04573ab9e
'}]
commit_message:
middleware & proxy-server share http code

This is one of a set of patches implementing a container-forwarding feature.
(see https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/cluster-federation)

Alternative to patch https://review.openstack.org/51242

Container_forwarding middleware needs to send requests to another proxy
instead of the usual backend servers: new module common/http_utils.py
provides such functionality.  Code is close to existing helper methods
in proxy/ob.py and proxy/base.py to minimize functionality change.
Methods in those two proxy modules can be replaced by the code in http_utils

Main changes:
- server.py: shows how proxy-server calls back container_forwarding middleware,
if present, to give it a handle on the newly created Controller object
- base.py: _make_app_iter commented out + call to new method in http_utils.py
- obj.py: send_file and chunk of PUT code commented out + call to new method
in http_utils.py
- buffered_http.py: only add device/partition to the path if they are set.
container_forwarding needs to forward the request to target proxy with the same
path_info it received.

Additional code:
- http_utils.py: helper methods to connect to endpoints and forward data
to/from such connected endpoint
- fake middleware: introduces method forward_request() that is used by
the real container_forwarding middleware. This method relies on http_utils
This middleware is for helping the review process only and will not be part
of the final patch. Its basic functionality is to forward all requests to a
configured target cluster.
- functional test: simple tests for the fake middleware, testing basic
operations such as create/delete containers/object.

Implements: blueprint cluster-federation

Change-Id: I98960c244048157d49174adca58ee5d04573ab9e

commit_message:
Container-forwarding unit and functional tests

This is one of a set of patches implementing a container-forwarding feature.
(see https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/cluster-federation)

Those tests will not pass unless they are run against the whole patch set
related to the container-forwarding middleware.

Change-Id: I6ae94685b9c300db749d2512436ca2a3872d517b
Implements: blueprint cluster-federation

subject: Refactor proxy/controllers obj & base http code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-11 16:09:41.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/fake_container_forwarding_http.py', 'setup.cfg', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'test/functional/tests_fake_container_forwarding_http.py', 'swift/proxy/server.py', 'swift/common/bufferedhttp.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': 'Refactor proxy/controllers obj & base http code

This is one of a set of patches implementing a container-forwarding feature.
(see https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/cluster-federation)

Refactoring enables reuse of the http code in GETorHEAD_base and object PUT.
Container_forwarding middleware needs to send requests to another proxy
instead of the usual backend servers: refactored code enables to avoid
code duplication and guarantees that middleware manages connections
(closing down, etc.) as the proxy does.

Main changes:
- server.py: shows how proxy-server calls back container_forwarding middleware,
if present, to give it a handle on the newly created Controller object
- base.py: refactoring of GETorHEAD_base without any mods
- obj.py: PUT split into two extra methods and _connect_put_node modified to
return a handle on connection object in all cases so that response with status
> 400 can be returned to the client from the target proxy in newly created
PUT_send
- buffered_http: only add device/partition to the path if they are set.
container_forwarding needs to forward the request to target proxy with the same
path_info it received.

Additional code:
- fake middleware: introduces method forward_request() that is used by
the real container_forwarding middleware. This method uses a new locally
defined ring with only one node (the target proxy) and no replication.
It also illustrates how the middleware calls the refactored methods
on the controller object using that ring.
This middleware is for helping the review process only and will not be part
of the final patch. Its basic functionality is to forward all requests to a
configured target cluster.
- functional test: simple tests for the fake middleware, testing basic
operations such as create/delete containers/object.

Change-Id: Ib88ee8f3aa9d1915eb115b6d4982bd8c4270db60
Implements: blueprint cluster-federation
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor proxy/controllers obj & base http code

This is one of a set of patches implementing a container-forwarding feature.
(see https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/cluster-federation)

Refactoring enables reuse of the http code in GETorHEAD_base and object PUT.
Container_forwarding middleware needs to send requests to another proxy
instead of the usual backend servers: refactored code enables to avoid
code duplication and guarantees that middleware manages connections
(closing down, etc.) as the proxy does.

Main changes:
- server.py: shows how proxy-server calls back container_forwarding middleware,
if present, to give it a handle on the newly created Controller object
- base.py: refactoring of GETorHEAD_base without any mods
- obj.py: PUT split into two extra methods and _connect_put_node modified to
return a handle on connection object in all cases so that response with status
> 400 can be returned to the client from the target proxy in newly created
PUT_send
- buffered_http: only add device/partition to the path if they are set.
container_forwarding needs to forward the request to target proxy with the same
path_info it received.

Additional code:
- fake middleware: introduces method forward_request() that is used by
the real container_forwarding middleware. This method uses a new locally
defined ring with only one node (the target proxy) and no replication.
It also illustrates how the middleware calls the refactored methods
on the controller object using that ring.
This middleware is for helping the review process only and will not be part
of the final patch. Its basic functionality is to forward all requests to a
configured target cluster.
- functional test: simple tests for the fake middleware, testing basic
operations such as create/delete containers/object.

Change-Id: Ib88ee8f3aa9d1915eb115b6d4982bd8c4270db60
Implements: blueprint cluster-federation

commit_message:
Archive config files along with logs

When debugging gate failures, it's useful to know what the config file
looked like in order to replicate issues locally or spot possible errors
at a glance.

This patch makes the cleanup function keep the config files of every
project (if present).

Change-Id: Id8a99c35e9e4370cfb316c5a4aae2899fea3f5bc

subject: Additional attempts to flosh stdout/stderr
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-12 20:02:55.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': 'Additional attempts to flosh stdout/stderr

The logfile output is piped through awk to apply a timestamp
and filter out all of the xtrace commands in the xtrace output.

A while back we added fflush("") which is supposed to flush all
open output files and pipes. It appears that gawk in precise
is old enough that it may only flush stdout, so explicitly
flush the logfile handle.

Change-Id: If5198c2da2a3278eed8ae3d50c7ca5c15eac6d94
'}]
commit_message:
Additional attempts to flosh stdout/stderr

The logfile output is piped through awk to apply a timestamp
and filter out all of the xtrace commands in the xtrace output.

A while back we added fflush("") which is supposed to flush all
open output files and pipes. It appears that gawk in precise
is old enough that it may only flush stdout, so explicitly
flush the logfile handle.

Change-Id: If5198c2da2a3278eed8ae3d50c7ca5c15eac6d94

Change-Id: Iab78d1efb7e40a3a67408f6e9a071723a3e931ff

commit_message:
Use DevStack functions in upgrade scripts

* Source target DevStack's functions in upgrade scripts to match what the
  project config functions expect.
* Source target DevStack's lib/tls in upgrade scripts that source
  target's lib/keystone (is_ssl_enabled_service())

Change-Id: Iab78d1efb7e40a3a67408f6e9a071723a3e931ff

commit_message:
remove docker from devstack

with I1c9bea2fdeebc4199c4f7d8fca4580a6fb7fed5b nova removed
docker from it's driver tree.

We shouldn't have driver support inside of devstack that's not
part of upstream projects (this has been a line we've been
pretty clear on with Neutron drivers in the past).

Remove docker driver accordingly.

Change-Id: Ib91d415ea1616d99a5c5e7bc3b9015392fda5847

commit_message:
Add Topology Tab for Services

This makes the following changes on Environment->Service
page:
 * Adds Tab for Services List inside Environment
 * Adds a new Tab for Topology Graph

Added new API function to render d3 data for topology graph.
Currently heat images are used.

Change-Id: Icae70a3d2668a9b18d1c716d7a60ebdcf2faf5ea
Implements: blueprint environment-topology-view

Second patch of three patches:
  1. exceptions
->2. config (+ module_utils.py)
  3. clients

It is very useful for new projects, who can just place

Much less merge conflicts and separation of base classes and

Change-Id: Iae5b100b2fc7021f6876fcaf610991c47811a49a

commit_message:
Implement pluggability for tempest (config)

Second patch of three patches:
  1. exceptions
->2. config (+ module_utils.py)
  3. clients

It is very useful for new projects, who can just place
needed files into appropriate dirs without changing
tempest core files.
Much less merge conflicts and separation of base classes and
child classes.

Partially-implements: bp make-tempest-pluggable

Change-Id: Iae5b100b2fc7021f6876fcaf610991c47811a49a

commit_message:
Add timeout option to stack-update

The API spec says the PUT which handles stack-update accepts a
timeout_mins argument, so add CLI support for it, making the
interface consistent with create/adopt.  Note this argument
currently isn't respected by heat, ref bug #1290603

Change-Id: Ie8d51540d0d93be51966e60601fd02d635cdae09
Closes-Bug: #1290456
Related-Bug: #1290603

subject: Deprecate create/adopt --create-timeout in favor of --timeout
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-12 15:18:27.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'heatclient/shell.py', 'heatclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Deprecate create/adopt --create-timeout in favor of --timeout

Replace the --create-timeout option with a more generic and intuitive
--timeout option, which can also later be used for update.

Since users may be using this option and it does currently work, leave
the old -c/--create-timeout option for now, but mark deprecated in the
usage and output a warning message if users use it.  To make this
warning visible the default loglevel is changed to WARNING.

Note neither timeout contains an integer default now, we rely on the
server-side default (which is 60mins anyway) as this make the fallback
to support the previous option easier and potentially to provide an
easier way to solve heat bug #1290603.

Partial-Bug: #1290456
Related-Bug: #1290603
Change-Id: Ia8c8d61b259ffa1f8a59d29a3e7fa7d9c128984f
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate create/adopt --create-timeout in favor of --timeout

Replace the --create-timeout option with a more generic and intuitive
--timeout option, which can also later be used for update.

Since users may be using this option and it does currently work, leave
the old -c/--create-timeout option for now, but mark deprecated in the
usage and output a warning message if users use it.  To make this
warning visible the default loglevel is changed to WARNING.

Note neither timeout contains an integer default now, we rely on the
server-side default (which is 60mins anyway) as this make the fallback
to support the previous option easier and potentially to provide an
easier way to solve heat bug #1290603.

Partial-Bug: #1290456
Related-Bug: #1290603
Change-Id: Ia8c8d61b259ffa1f8a59d29a3e7fa7d9c128984f

commit_message:
rsync configurations to support multi-node swift

Right now we only support an all-in-one swift node. To go
to multi-node swift we need to configure rsync for replication.

See http://docs.openstack.org/havana/install-guide/install/yum/content/installing-and-configuring-storage-nodes.html

Depends on a service mapping change for diskimage-builder:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76753/

Change-Id: Idd3b408e3ef900fa6223c2762b2f6744f179bc00

commit_message:
Splits service_instance module from generic driver

This module may be used by arbitrary share driver
if it uses multitenancy approach of generic driver.
Methods, responsible for managing nova instances
and setting up network connectivity were taken out
from generic driver to this module.

Implements: bp generic-driver-modularity
Change-Id: Iedf5eee4db716fd0c75ac3b49af975e0e2284ab2

subject: No need to add the new entry for image location
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-14 06:59:18.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/test_db.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'No need to add the new entry for image location

If the glance image update api is called and a new image location url is specified,
the old locations are soft deleted and new locations are added to db, but this
should not happen if both old and new locations are same urls

The fix has been added so that if both old and new locations are same urls,
new entry will not get added in to the database under image_locations table

Change-Id: I4bb96a48675e83cfe2f50c912d41b40871d2cd66
Closes-Bug: #1205006
'}]
commit_message:
No need to add the new entry for image location

If the glance image update api is called and a new image location url is specified,
the old locations are soft deleted and new locations are added to db, but this
should not happen if both old and new locations are same urls

The fix has been added so that if both old and new locations are same urls,
new entry will not get added in to the database under image_locations table

Change-Id: I4bb96a48675e83cfe2f50c912d41b40871d2cd66
Closes-Bug: #1205006

commit_message:
Fixed Instance Status usage

    Instance Status in Instance Service Status were inconsistently
    used in the code base.  Sometime strings were used in places of
    object. Sometimes the wrong object type was used in place of
    another.  Sometimes lower-case strings were compared to
    upper-case string
    Added comments and type hints in various classes
    to prevent further issues and to aid in troubleshooting
    Changed usage of mysql to datastore in instance and task
    functions

Partially Implements: blueprint improve-instance-status
Change-Id: I3e36d4ab879073b685a0585d02a62dfe157a5b3c

[{'number': 16, 'created': '2014-03-11 10:33:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'Fixing lost vlan ids on interfaces

Sometimes a vm gets its tap interface unset and reset too fast to be caught in
an agent loop, and its vlan tag was not reset.

We now detect if an interface loses its vlan tag, and if it happens the
interface will be reconfigured.

Since the TAG ID is only available via the "Port" table (in the 'tag' column),
we couldn't reuse the get_vif_port_set() method's run_vsctl call which queries
the "Interface" table, and needed a specific run_vsct call to the "Port" table
in the new get_port_tag_dict() method.

Change-Id: I7f59e2c1e757c28dae35c44ebfad9d764ae1d3c5
Closes-Bug: 1240849
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing lost vlan ids on interfaces

Sometimes a vm gets its tap interface unset and reset too fast to be caught in
an agent loop, and its vlan tag was not reset.

We now detect if an interface loses its vlan tag, and if it happens the
interface will be reconfigured.

Since the TAG ID is only available via the "Port" table (in the 'tag' column),
we couldn't reuse the get_vif_port_set() method's run_vsctl call which queries
the "Interface" table, and needed a specific run_vsct call to the "Port" table
in the new get_port_tag_dict() method.

Change-Id: I7f59e2c1e757c28dae35c44ebfad9d764ae1d3c5
Closes-Bug: 1240849

subject: Wait for baremetal nodes before creating undercloud stack.
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-03-13 16:46:27.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_undercloud.sh', 'scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh'], 'message': 'Wait for baremetal nodes before creating undercloud stack.

devtest_undercloud can fail due to attempting to bring up heat
stack before baremetal nodes are available in the seed. This
issue is typically triggered when devtest is run with cached
images, as the undercloud stack creation occurs soon after
baremetal node setup in the seed in that scenario. This change
introduces a wait for baremetal node to be available before
bringing up undercloud heat stack.

Closes-Bug: #1288199
Change-Id: I720ebf1333607b0daa2f8989f7e31d02f7903ef3
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for baremetal nodes before creating undercloud stack.

devtest_undercloud can fail due to attempting to bring up heat
stack before baremetal nodes are available in the seed. This
issue is typically triggered when devtest is run with cached
images, as the undercloud stack creation occurs soon after
baremetal node setup in the seed in that scenario. This change
introduces a wait for baremetal node to be available before
bringing up undercloud heat stack.

Closes-Bug: #1288199
Change-Id: I720ebf1333607b0daa2f8989f7e31d02f7903ef3

subject: Ceilo/Ironic/Tuskar: don't hard code venv dir
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-03-14 00:19:56.000000000', 'files': ['elements/ceilometer/environment.d/10-ceilometer-venv-dir.bash', 'elements/ironic-conductor/post-install.d/68-ironic-conductor', 'elements/ceilometer/install.d/68-ceilometer', 'elements/tuskar/environment.d/10-tuskar-venv-dir.bash', 'elements/tuskar/install.d/100-tuskar-api', 'elements/ironic/environment.d/10-ironic-venv-dir.bash', 'elements/tuskar/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/100-tuskar-api', 'elements/ironic/install.d/68-ironic', 'elements/ceilometer-agent-compute/install.d/69-ceilometer-agent-compute', 'elements/ironic-api/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/68-ironic-api'], 'message': "Ceilo/Ironic/Tuskar: don't hard code venv dir

Updates the ceilometer/ironic/tuskar elements so that we use a new
{SERVICE}_VENV_DIR variable (set via an environment.d hook)
to configure the virtualenv directory.

This is cleaner in that we aren't hard coding /opt/stack/venv
everywhere and also supports both isolated and shared
venvs (which some people would like to use).

Change-Id: I5a4deef3ed79f4b633f273a37cec2aa5a8dbc698

commit_message:
Ceilo/Ironic/Tuskar: don't hard code venv dir

Updates the ceilometer/ironic/tuskar elements so that we use a new
{SERVICE}_VENV_DIR variable (set via an environment.d hook)
to configure the virtualenv directory.

This is cleaner in that we aren't hard coding /opt/stack/venv
everywhere and also supports both isolated and shared
venvs (which some people would like to use).

Change-Id: I5a4deef3ed79f4b633f273a37cec2aa5a8dbc698

commit_message:
Add basic timing instrumentation to devtest.sh

Adding basic instrumentation to devtest to gain an understanding of
the time used for each step, and the impact of adding elements such
as pip-cache. Also allows comparison of runtime for different network
environments.

commit_message:
Volume operations should be blocked for non-null task state

Currently volume attach, detach, and swap check on vm_state but
not task_state.  This means that, for example, volume attach is
allowed even when other operations such as migration are in
progress.  As with other operations the check should be against
a task state of "None"

This change also refactors the volume_attach() method a little
so that the cells api can include the state decorator checks.

Change-Id: I0c4d697cf9d9e431a050c3c1b03e46b8629d182a
Closes-Bug: #1274627

commit_message:
Glance/Cinder/Keystone/Swift: don't hard code venv

Updates the cinder/glance/keystone/swift elements so that we use a new
{SERVICE}_VENV_DIR variable (set via an environment.d hook)
to configure the virtualenv directory.

This is cleaner in that we aren't hard coding /opt/stack/venv
everywhere and also supports both isolated and shared
venvs (which some people would like to use).

Change-Id: Ic2cbbf48bad0db092fe6c0a5a9ddda6f883a499b

commit_message:
Allow nodes to send `null` in disk model field

Sometimes our discovery agents collects invalid data and sends it to
Nailgun. Because of adding JsonSchema for validation node model, the
requests with partially invalid data will fail and agents will not
be able to register themself.

Closes-Bug: #1292010
Change-Id: I319b142628e29e6706df71f0336a4d3ea71ddc22

subject: Remove incompatible boto versions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-26 21:39:07.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Remove incompatible boto versions

euca2ools is used for bundling ec2 images, but the version used on the
gate in shipped by alsmost all Linux distribution (<=euca2ools-2.1.4),
is not compatible with boto>2.21,<2.25.0.

The upstream boto repositiry contains the fix
https://github.com/boto/boto/pull/2094,but new version not released yet.

Skipping only the boto versions which really incompatible.

Change-Id: I477664f28590125af8bf10d324ec2ef1e89a45fc
'}]
commit_message:
Remove incompatible boto versions

euca2ools is used for bundling ec2 images, but the version used on the
gate in shipped by alsmost all Linux distribution (<=euca2ools-2.1.4),
is not compatible with boto>2.21,<2.25.0.

The upstream boto repositiry contains the fix
https://github.com/boto/boto/pull/2094,but new version not released yet.

Skipping only the boto versions which really incompatible.

Change-Id: I477664f28590125af8bf10d324ec2ef1e89a45fc
