commit_message:
Move _run_post_backup to __exit__ method

Reasons:
 - until the "with runner" execution is done , guest can't
    be sure that backup phase is done and
    _run_post_backup () can be called.
Changes:
 - moving _run_post_backup() to __exit()

Change-Id: I24f39653f661a5d34157fe992bba837ae7731da1
Closes-Bug: #1291910

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-13 17:44:21.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/test/tests/tables.py', 'horizon/tables/base.py'], 'message': 'Handle failures on column filters more gracefully

With certain inputs it's possible for filters to fail, however we
should still display the table as well as return the data we have even
if it didn't go through one filter successfully.

We're still expecting "filters" to be made of functions, therefore the
func_name attribute should exist.

Note that this warning message being displayed still indicates that
there is a programming error somewhere that should be fixed.

Related-Bug: #1286959
Change-Id: I408dc9fbdaa7dfe49a39ad3a96a0e1256f6a99eb
'}]
commit_message:
Handle failures on column filters more gracefully

With certain inputs it's possible for filters to fail, however we
should still display the table as well as return the data we have even
if it didn't go through one filter successfully.

We're still expecting "filters" to be made of functions, therefore the
func_name attribute should exist.

Note that this warning message being displayed still indicates that
there is a programming error somewhere that should be fixed.

Related-Bug: #1286959
Change-Id: I408dc9fbdaa7dfe49a39ad3a96a0e1256f6a99eb

commit_message:
Client implementation of statistics aggregators. This allows to do
API calls on /v2/meters/meter-name/statistics?aggregate.func=func-name

aggregates = [{'func': 'cardinality', 'param': 'resource_id'}])
client.statistics.list(meter_name="instance", aggregates=aggregates)

subject: Fix glance db migration failed on 031
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6484, 'name': 'Feilong Wang', 'email': 'hustemb@gmail.com', 'username': 'flwang'}, {'_account_id': 6549, 'name': 'Zhi Yan Liu', 'email': 'lzy.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'lzy-dev'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8112, 'name': 'Ma Wen Cheng', 'email': 'wenchma@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'wenchma'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-05 08:51:41.000000000', 'files': ['glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/031_remove_duplicated_locations.py'], 'message': 'Fix glance db migration failed on 031

In fact, the first where expression has filtered the duplicated locations,
and the second filters the locations which have more than 1 rows, so the
second result set is included in the first.
In DB2, if the boolean of where expression is true, it will throw error.
So remove the second where expression to fix glance db migration failed on 031.

Fixes bug #1287087

Change-Id: Id485b6d20696e989d10f3759011387137543918a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix glance db migration failed on 031

In fact, the first where expression has filtered the duplicated locations,
and the second filters the locations which have more than 1 rows, so the
second result set is included in the first.
In DB2, if the boolean of where expression is true, it will throw error.
So remove the second where expression to fix glance db migration failed on 031.

Fixes bug #1287087

Change-Id: Id485b6d20696e989d10f3759011387137543918a

subject: Catch exception when image cache pruning
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-28 17:28:19.000000000', 'files': ['glance/image_cache/drivers/sqlite.py'], 'message': 'Catch exception when image cache pruning

If a cached image file does not exist, os.stat will throw an exception
and the glance-cache-pruner can fail to run when it encounters
the non-existent file.

Adds a catch for the possible exception and sets file size to 0 so
the glance-cache-pruner can successfully run and prune the cache.

Change-Id: I55bee82c4a7aa0393d36c603c91adb8b44a7c7a3
Fixes: bug #1286240
'}]
commit_message:
Catch exception when image cache pruning

If a cached image file does not exist, os.stat will throw an exception
and the glance-cache-pruner can fail to run when it encounters
the non-existent file.

Adds a catch for the possible exception and sets file size to 0 so
the glance-cache-pruner can successfully run and prune the cache.

Change-Id: I55bee82c4a7aa0393d36c603c91adb8b44a7c7a3
Fixes: bug #1286240

 project

commit_message:
Make imports proper order

We have a rule for imports order. That is:
 stdlib
 third-party lib
 project
 http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports
But some files are not correct. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I0031677e30dd70a07125d7a11bc93963db2b8ce3

commit_message:
Include Location header in POST /tasks response

In addition to returning a 201, a successful POST to /tasks
should include a Location header with the direct path to the
newly created resource.

Closes-bug: #1287760

Change-Id: I11001e1d6bb5168f0ee80c3d81574e59ddd47147

commit_message:
Replace assertNotEqual(None, *) with assertIsNotNone in tests

Replace assertNotEqual(None, *) with assertIsNotNone in tests to have
clearer messages in case of failure. And also, this commit enhances N318
hacking rule for catching this violation.

Change-Id: I406ea23b0e78f45f16306813e4111a95716cd6b0
Related-Bug: #1280522

commit_message:
Specify hypervisor connection string explicitly

Set connection string explicitly in order to make
virsh work with newer version of libvirt which
allows you to run your own separate daemon in
your home directory along with the system one

Change-Id: Ibb5e429e3f7e2cd0dde998eacc8f0cc4f3494d20

commit_message:
Updates Conductor API to use just objects id's

There are several methods in the Conductor API that require
an entire object as parameter, but then they only use the id
value in it.
This fix updates these conductor methods for just using id's as
needed. Test cases and calls to these methods have also been
modified for using the new methods definitions.
The fixed conductor methods are:
migration_update, aggregate_host_add, aggregate_host_delete,
aggregate_metadata_add, aggregate_metadata_delete,
security_group_rule_get_by_security_group, compute_node_update,
compute_node_delete, service_update.

Change-Id: Ie39a4d08407edd10dc1dd95f5bc69275fdfeb22b
Closes-Bug: #1204594

commit_message:
Expose 'host' and 'details' info to instance action v3 API

Exposing 'host' and 'details' information in v3 API result of instance
action get request. 'host' field records where this event took place,
and 'details' field is for detail explanation or additional information
of one particular event.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint improve-instance-action-events

Change-Id: I446de37863cc6f12b8d50649f1bb4449cb673c78

commit_message:
NSX: only catch not found update_port

Update port currently wraps the call to NSX in try/except Exception:
which could hide bugs. This patch makes sure only NotFound is caught
and not everything.

Change-Id: Id4412dca74363e4db6402bfb6e3e880d8c601383
Closes-bug: #1287423

This patch re-enables lazy translation to enable REST API
responses to be translated to the requested locale (i.e. setting
'Accept-Language: zh-CN'.)

It also forces immediate translation of messages with complex
format strings to work around current limitation in the oslo

Change-Id: Ic6b9400cafbac8b350b57081c8747c3b84a99737
implements-bp: i18n-messages

commit_message:
Re-enable lazy translation

This patch re-enables lazy translation to enable REST API
responses to be translated to the requested locale (i.e. setting
'Accept-Language: zh-CN'.)

It also forces immediate translation of messages with complex
format strings to work around current limitation in the oslo
gettextutils.Message class.

Change-Id: Ic6b9400cafbac8b350b57081c8747c3b84a99737
implements-bp: i18n-messages

commit_message:
Store consoleauth tokens into database

Add a new database table for storing the consoleauth tokens and the
related DB object. Also change the cauth service to use the new object
besides storing the tokens in memory.

With this change it is possible to have multiple consoleauth services in
the same cluster without the need of relying on one memcached service.

Implements blueprint consoleauth-tokens-in-db

Change-Id: I2ca7b8b7a671c1edeeec6bc85fea85a5b9bfd514

commit_message:
Adding image multiple location support -- separate configure option

Move the hypervisor special image handler option to separated
configuration group. This could make image handler option more clear and
sense for end user and allow follow particular handler implementation
changes enabling handler extension easily.

Implement bp: image-multiple-location
DocImpact

Change-Id: I5954a651b999e2ce28da227c77835d87de5a6652
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <lzy.dev@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove exception messages from dashboard

Exceptions should not be shown to the user since can expose/reveal
sensitive system information.

A general approach will be addressed by bp/improve-error-message-details-for-usability
to improve error messages.
The only exception kept is at admin dashboard currently.

Co-Authored-By: Victoria Martinez De La Cruz <victoria@vmartinezdelacruz.com>

Closes-Bug: #1282232
Related-Bug: #1286104
Change-Id: Ifc539cac03eac3a93aa3f62711d51c17527ce713

commit_message:
Remove None for dict.get()

Because If no default value is specified it defaults to None already.

Change-Id: Id8a795fa6de0cb895b04a6dd683ddf2a7b2c034c

commit_message:
NSX: port status must reflect fabric, not link status

This patch ensures the status attribute for the port resource is
semantically consistent with the reference plugin when using the
NSX plugin.

Change-Id: Ifb9c7664da926d3e6d5c6ec7c0e375b53a97582a
Closes-Bug: 1285426
(cherry picked from commit 67aae424118c5eb79f666e53cc56d3be1caaced6)

commit_message:
Assign IP from the network pool, not entire table

When we try to assign an IP to a node, we use all IPs in DB to determine
which IPs already used. Since now we will use only IPs from a particular
NetworkGroup.

Change-Id: I2c133e2589fdbf2906ccd5b430717ddc69e0ed54
Closes-Bug: #1287021

so that they can transparently work with older
vSphere hypervisors that may have missing WSDL
file components. This tool seamlessly and
transparently fixes the WSDL so that you no longer
have to use a work-around of any kind.

DocImpact

Blueprint: autowsdl-repair
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: autowsdl-repair utility fixes WSDL for SUDS

This is a small utility for use with VMware drivers
so that they can transparently work with older
vSphere hypervisors that may have missing WSDL
file components. This tool seamlessly and
transparently fixes the WSDL so that you no longer
have to use a work-around of any kind.

DocImpact
Adds optional configuration enable_wsdl_cleaner
to the vmware group.

Change-Id: I8fe5fec9daba5fea52bcdba9b45ae25223e93e20
Blueprint: autowsdl-repair

Adds a config option osapi_v2_enabled which controls whether

the V3 API there is not an osapi_v3 section and for backwards

commit_message:
Adds ability to disable the V2 API

Adds a config option osapi_v2_enabled which controls whether
the V2 API is enabled or not. It is enabled by default. Unlike
the V3 API there is not an osapi_v3 section and for backwards
compatibility reasons it's not worth doing it now.

Part of blueprint nova-v3-api
DocImpact: new config option osapi_v2_enabled

Change-Id: I222ddc32cde9a9ad57980b3271c462faa2e7630c

commit_message:
Add request/access token and consumer support for keystoneclient

Add support for creating request and access tokens,
and to authorize request tokens. Also adding basic CRUD for
consumer entities.

implements: bp add-oauth-support

Change-Id: I9137e3426c82c73855ae0e50317cfd6477195318

Fix wrong key for 'usage.summary.instances' in CSV summary

In the project overview, the key for 'usage.summary.instances' the CSV
summary is wrong, it should be "Active Instances" instead of "Total
Active VCPUs".

Closes-bug: 1288020

commit_message:
user_storage_quota now accept KB, MB and GB

user_storage_quota now accept value in B, KB, MB or GB.
The unit is optional. If no unit is specified Bytes is
used as default.

Change-Id: I3addd360a3a14c3297d9970ac88dc3248fbafc0b
Closes-Bug: #1261747

subject: Make cors work better.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 866, 'name': 'Chmouel Boudjnah', 'email': 'chmouel@chmouel.com', 'username': 'chmouel'}, {'_account_id': 904, 'name': 'Adrian Smith', 'email': 'adrian@17od.com', 'username': 'adriansmith'}, {'_account_id': 995, 'name': 'David Goetz', 'email': 'david.goetz@rackspace.com', 'username': 'david-goetz'}, {'_account_id': 1009, 'name': 'Greg Lange', 'email': 'greglange@gmail.com', 'username': 'greglange'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 1216, 'name': 'gholt', 'email': 'z-launchpad@brim.net', 'username': 'gholt'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-03-12 01:58:55.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/functional/test_object.py', 'doc/source/cors.rst', 'swift/common/wsgi.py', 'swift/proxy/server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': 'Make cors work better.

CORS doesn't really work with swift right now. OPTIONS calls for the most part
work but for so called "simple cross-site requests" (i.e. those that don't
require a pre-flight OPTIONS request) Swift always returns the Origin it was
given as the Access-Control-Allow-Origin in the response. This makes CORS
"work" for these requests but if you actually wanted the javascript user agent
to restrict anything for you it wouldn't be able to!

You can duplicate the issue with updated CORS test page:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/cors.html#test-cors-page

And a public container with an 'X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Allow-Origin'
that does NOT match the webserver hosting the test-cors-page.

e.g.

with a public container that accepts cross-site requests from "example.com":

`swift post cors-container -m access-control-allow-origin:example.com -r .r:*`

You could point your browser at a copy of the test-cors-page on your
filesystem (the browser will will send 'Origin: null')

Without a token the XMLHttpRequest will not request any custom headers (i.e.
Access-Control-Request-Headers: x-auth-token) and the request will be made
with-out a preflight OPTIONS request (which Swift would have denied anyway
because the origin's don't match)

i.e. fill in "http://saio:8080/v1/AUTH_test/cors-container" for "URL" and
leave "Token" blank.

You would expect that the browser would not complete the request because
"Origin: null" does not match the configured "Access-Control-Allow-Origin:
example.com" on the container metadata, and indeed with this patch - it won't!

Also:

The way cors is set up does not play well with certain applications for swift.
If you are running a CDN on top of swift and you have the
Access-Control-Allow-Origin cors header set to * then you probably want the *
to be cached on the the CDN, not the Origin that happened to result in an
origin request.

Also:

If you were unfortunate enough to allow cors headers to be saved directly
onto objects then this allows them to supersede the headers coming from the
container.

NOTE: There is a change is behavior with this patch. Because its cors, a
      spec that was created only to cause annoyance to all, I'll write out
      what's being changed and hopefully someone will speak up if it breaks
      there stuff.

previous behavior: When a request was made with a Origin header set the
                   cors_validation decorator would always add that origin as
                   the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header in the response-
                   whether the passed origin was a match with the container's
                   X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Allow-Origin or not, or even
                   if the container did not have CORS set up at all.
new behavior: If strict_cors_mode is set to True in the proxy-server.conf
              (which is the default) the cors_validation decorator will only
              add the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header to the response when
              the request's Origin matches the value set in
              X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Allow-Origin. NOTE- if the
              container does not have CORS set up it won't just magically start
              working. Furthremore, if the Origin doesn't match the
              Access-Control-Allow-Origin - a successfully authorized request
              (either by token or public ACL) won't be *denied* - it just
              won't include the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header (it's up
              to the security model in the browser to cancel the request
              if the response doesn't include a matching Allow-Origin
              header).  On the other hand, if you want to restrict requests
              with CORS, you can actually do it now.

              If you are worried about breaking current functionality you
              must set:

              strict_cors_mode = False

              in the proxy-server.conf. This will continue with returning the
              passed in Origin as the Access-Control-Allow-Origin in the
              response.

previous: If you had X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Allow-Origin set to *
          and you passed in Origin: http://hey.com you'd get
          Access-Control-Allow-Origin: http://hey.com back. This was true for
          both OPTIONS and regular reqs.
new: With X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Allow-Origin set to * you get * back
     for both OPTIONS and regular reqs.

previous: cors headers saved directly onto objects (by allowing them to be
          saved via the allowed_headers config in the object-server conf)
          would be overridden by whatever container cors you have set up.
new: For regular (non-OPTIONS) calls the object headers will be kept. The
     container cors will only be applied to objects without the
     'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' and 'Access-Control-Expose-Headers' headers.
     This behavior doesn't make a whole lot of sense for OPTIONS calls so I
     left that as is. I don't think that allowing cors headers to be saved
     directly onto objects is a good idea and it should be discouraged.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I9b0219407e77c77a9bb1133cbcb179a4c681c4a8
'}]
commit_message:
Make cors work better.

CORS doesn't really work with swift right now. OPTIONS calls for the most part
work but for so called "simple cross-site requests" (i.e. those that don't
require a pre-flight OPTIONS request) Swift always returns the Origin it was
given as the Access-Control-Allow-Origin in the response. This makes CORS
"work" for these requests but if you actually wanted the javascript user agent
to restrict anything for you it wouldn't be able to!

You can duplicate the issue with updated CORS test page:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/cors.html#test-cors-page

And a public container with an 'X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Allow-Origin'
that does NOT match the webserver hosting the test-cors-page.

e.g.

with a public container that accepts cross-site requests from "example.com":

`swift post cors-container -m access-control-allow-origin:example.com -r .r:*`

You could point your browser at a copy of the test-cors-page on your
filesystem (the browser will will send 'Origin: null')

Without a token the XMLHttpRequest will not request any custom headers (i.e.
Access-Control-Request-Headers: x-auth-token) and the request will be made
with-out a preflight OPTIONS request (which Swift would have denied anyway
because the origin's don't match)

i.e. fill in "http://saio:8080/v1/AUTH_test/cors-container" for "URL" and
leave "Token" blank.

You would expect that the browser would not complete the request because
"Origin: null" does not match the configured "Access-Control-Allow-Origin:
example.com" on the container metadata, and indeed with this patch - it won't!

Also:

The way cors is set up does not play well with certain applications for swift.
If you are running a CDN on top of swift and you have the
Access-Control-Allow-Origin cors header set to * then you probably want the *
to be cached on the the CDN, not the Origin that happened to result in an
origin request.

Also:

If you were unfortunate enough to allow cors headers to be saved directly
onto objects then this allows them to supersede the headers coming from the
container.

NOTE: There is a change is behavior with this patch. Because its cors, a
      spec that was created only to cause annoyance to all, I'll write out
      what's being changed and hopefully someone will speak up if it breaks
      there stuff.

previous behavior: When a request was made with a Origin header set the
                   cors_validation decorator would always add that origin as
                   the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header in the response-
                   whether the passed origin was a match with the container's
                   X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Allow-Origin or not, or even
                   if the container did not have CORS set up at all.
new behavior: If strict_cors_mode is set to True in the proxy-server.conf
              (which is the default) the cors_validation decorator will only
              add the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header to the response when
              the request's Origin matches the value set in
              X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Allow-Origin. NOTE- if the
              container does not have CORS set up it won't just magically start
              working. Furthremore, if the Origin doesn't match the
              Access-Control-Allow-Origin - a successfully authorized request
              (either by token or public ACL) won't be *denied* - it just
              won't include the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header (it's up
              to the security model in the browser to cancel the request
              if the response doesn't include a matching Allow-Origin
              header).  On the other hand, if you want to restrict requests
              with CORS, you can actually do it now.

              If you are worried about breaking current functionality you
              must set:

              strict_cors_mode = False

              in the proxy-server.conf. This will continue with returning the
              passed in Origin as the Access-Control-Allow-Origin in the
              response.

previous: If you had X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Allow-Origin set to *
          and you passed in Origin: http://hey.com you'd get
          Access-Control-Allow-Origin: http://hey.com back. This was true for
          both OPTIONS and regular reqs.
new: With X-Container-Meta-Access-Control-Allow-Origin set to * you get * back
     for both OPTIONS and regular reqs.

previous: cors headers saved directly onto objects (by allowing them to be
          saved via the allowed_headers config in the object-server conf)
          would be overridden by whatever container cors you have set up.
new: For regular (non-OPTIONS) calls the object headers will be kept. The
     container cors will only be applied to objects without the
     'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' and 'Access-Control-Expose-Headers' headers.
     This behavior doesn't make a whole lot of sense for OPTIONS calls so I
     left that as is. I don't think that allowing cors headers to be saved
     directly onto objects is a good idea and it should be discouraged.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I9b0219407e77c77a9bb1133cbcb179a4c681c4a8

subject: change the vmdk to the one used in VMWare ci
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-13 13:57:13.000000000', 'files': ['stackrc'], 'message': "change the vmdk to the one used in VMWare ci

The debian image that defaults to being using with vmware is huge,
and it turns out it's not actually used in VMWare ci so we don't
really know if it's working. Instead use the vmdk that is used
in VMWare ci, which we know will boot, as we get results everyday.

Change-Id: I014746af293852525e2bd128c4d19f5889ecd55d
"}]
commit_message:
change the vmdk to the one used in VMWare ci

The debian image that defaults to being using with vmware is huge,
and it turns out it's not actually used in VMWare ci so we don't
really know if it's working. Instead use the vmdk that is used
in VMWare ci, which we know will boot, as we get results everyday.

Change-Id: I014746af293852525e2bd128c4d19f5889ecd55d

commit_message:
Send network-changed notifications to nova

This patch notifies nova whenever a floatingip or fixed_ip is updated.

Implements blueprint: nova-event-callback

DocImpact - This notifications are off by default.

 temporary solution until engine is a standalone process.

Change-Id: I4666ca5f1a9cb093e8b7c9e640048f0176955595

commit_message:
Fixing executor launch script

* Executor launch script should now start engine because
 it calls engine.convey_task_result() directly. It's a
 temporary solution until engine is a standalone process.
 When it's done executor will be sending a message back to
 engine instead of making a local call.

Change-Id: I4666ca5f1a9cb093e8b7c9e640048f0176955595

commit_message:
Use itertools instead of custom count

Itertools.count() does the same thing as
what the previous code does, so just use
that instead of custom code. This helps
reduce the amount of custom code.

Change-Id: I549889e9e1d1f607dfdbb467feffdd66dc825999

commit_message:
Handle Token/Endpoint authentication

This is essentially the Admin token where your authentication will
always use a given token and have no means of querying information from
within that token blob.

Change-Id: Ia4317836d6fc1e62c65a1dcbd84c820d90832dc4

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-12 15:46:54.000000000', 'files': ['solum/builder/app.py', 'solum/api/app.py', 'etc/solum/solum.conf.sample'], 'message': 'Changing Solum listening ports to 127.0.0.1 default

If an operator is running a private instance of Solum, the default setting
should not listen to external ports (secure by default).  Opening up Solum to

commit_message:
Changing Solum listening ports to 127.0.0.1 default

If an operator is running a private instance of Solum, the default setting
should not listen to external ports (secure by default).  Opening up Solum to
public IP address ranges should be a manual and purposeful operator operation.

Change-Id: Ica2590bca08380508ee6dea0b9ee8b5467cc3e5f

Closes-Bug: #1284341

commit_message:
Fix db_version failed with wrong arguments

The `keystone-manage db_version` command was failing with an error
like

 TypeError: db_version() takes exactly 2 arguments (1 given)

This is because an engine wasn't being passed to db_version().

Change-Id: I20b4cb10f9c83fc672de2838bac8236938b92e32
Closes-Bug: #1284341

subject: VMware: fix bug for exceptions thrown in _wait_for_task
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-18 16:55:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py'], 'message': 'VMware: fix bug for exceptions thrown in _wait_for_task

If the _call_method fails, for example a resource is not found,
then the same call will be invoked again due to the fact that the
polling task was not stopped.

Closes-Bug: #1246848

Change-Id: If4818e41aed5be03395ab22afc0edf9abb3c34e1
(cherry picked from commit 1c1570ff7ac8470d7dba28c893300835b22e0966)
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: fix bug for exceptions thrown in _wait_for_task

If the _call_method fails, for example a resource is not found,
then the same call will be invoked again due to the fact that the
polling task was not stopped.

Closes-Bug: #1246848

Change-Id: If4818e41aed5be03395ab22afc0edf9abb3c34e1
(cherry picked from commit 1c1570ff7ac8470d7dba28c893300835b22e0966)

subject: Fix exception message of CoraidESMConfigureError
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-11 01:45:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/exception.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/coraid.py'], 'message': 'Fix exception message of CoraidESMConfigureError

Since 'message' is the same name as the second argument to the
constructor of CinderException, 'message="Oorah"' is not a keyword
argument.

Therefore, "message = _('ESM configure request failed: %(message)s.')"
doesn't work correctly.

Then, remove the redundant period.

Change-Id: Iafc457197fc3993f9f942babcdda0cd79b7bd518
Closes-Bug: #1290627
'}]
commit_message:
Fix exception message of CoraidESMConfigureError

Since 'message' is the same name as the second argument to the
constructor of CinderException, 'message="Oorah"' is not a keyword
argument.

Therefore, "message = _('ESM configure request failed: %(message)s.')"
doesn't work correctly.

Then, remove the redundant period.

Change-Id: Iafc457197fc3993f9f942babcdda0cd79b7bd518
Closes-Bug: #1290627

commit_message:
Sync latest Oslo code for imageutils

This sync pulls the latest Oslo imageutils code over to cinder
to fix QemuImgInfo parsing needed by NFS drivers.

-> b455fac Enable decimal value input in imageutils.QemuImgInfo
--> cinder/openstack/common/imageutils.py

Oslo version:
-> 0e98afd Re-raise exception of unloadable library
-> Date:   Tue Mar 4 17:26:40 2014 +0100

Change-Id: I770b0f534c6949c2ff6995a03923a21ed26e04da
Closes-Bug: 1285764

subject: make git_clone safer
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-12 17:05:48.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': 'make git_clone safer

the ensures that if the function returns early, we return to a
sane directory, and not hang out somewhere that a future git
call might modify a directory in a weird way. This is especially
important in the case of stable branches where were are hopping
between stable for servers and master for clients.

Change-Id: Ib8ebbc23b1813bc1bfb31d0a079f1b882135bd39
'}]
commit_message:
make git_clone safer

the ensures that if the function returns early, we return to a
sane directory, and not hang out somewhere that a future git
call might modify a directory in a weird way. This is especially
important in the case of stable branches where were are hopping
between stable for servers and master for clients.

Change-Id: Ib8ebbc23b1813bc1bfb31d0a079f1b882135bd39

commit_message:
Block database access in nova-network binary

This mirrors the code we have in cmd/compute.py to wedge the database
module so that we can't add any more direct calls, and will highlight
any stragglers.

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

Change-Id: Ib12415d84de950265626b4a804f33717203d9765
Related-bug: 1290568

subject: Fix nova-bm race condition with cached images.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-13 21:52:31.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_undercloud.sh', 'scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh'], 'message': 'Fix nova-bm race condition with cached images.

devtest can fail due to attempting to bring up heat stack before
baremetal nodes are available due to the latency between node
registration and exporting to the scheduler.

This is an alternative implementation to
I720ebf1333607b0daa2f8989f7e31d02f7903ef3.

Closes-Bug: #1288199
Change-Id: I3fca328a2fddf36106a1a17aacaa13e39a45b8a0
Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nova-bm race condition with cached images.

devtest can fail due to attempting to bring up heat stack before
baremetal nodes are available due to the latency between node
registration and exporting to the scheduler.

This is an alternative implementation to
I720ebf1333607b0daa2f8989f7e31d02f7903ef3.

Closes-Bug: #1288199
Change-Id: I3fca328a2fddf36106a1a17aacaa13e39a45b8a0
Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>

The account reaper, container synchronizer, and replicators

commit_message:
Allow hostname for nodes in Ring

This change modifies the swift-ring-builder so that hostnames
can be used in place of an ip-address for the add node command.
The account reaper, container synchronizer, and replicators
were also updated so that they still have a way to identify
a particular device as being "local".

Change-Id: Ic3fbbd0a3cfc4d685a18eb33d8639665a2ce089a

commit_message:
Import access module from keystoneclient to handle V3 endpoints

* service_catalog.py will be used only by nova(cinder.py), it will be removed if nova
uses access instead of service_catalog. Then service_catalog.py and
test_service_catalog.py will be removed from cinderclient if necessary.

* Some unit tests are modified.

* Because of JSON format's modification, functions that process cinder
credentials and cinder endpoints are changed.

* Add dependency for keystoneclient in requirements.txt.

Change-Id: Icf7badfdddcf5f55536d95db7242aff58aa34b6e
Closes-Bug: #1263876
bp: service-catalog

Change-Id: I12dfaca868a3f0aec2a85fe45d8a524940d9eae0

commit_message:
Configure the ec2 zone explicitly

Tempest now creates Availability zones which in parallel run,
may causes issues with EC2 tests.

The EC2 tests will use the preconfigured zone, instead of just picking a
random existing zone.

Closes-Bug: 1265672
Change-Id: I12dfaca868a3f0aec2a85fe45d8a524940d9eae0

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary oauth1.Manager constructions

There's an oauth1.Manager kept in the global dependency that's
created when the oauth1 extension is loaded due to being in the
paste pipeline, so there's no need to create more of them.

Closes-Bug: #1291705
Change-Id: I78e19e3b165b4cd503e2da6a135daa54e98de599

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1918, 'name': 'François Charlier', 'email': 'francois.charlier@redhat.com', 'username': 'francois-charlier'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6967, 'name': 'Chris Ricker', 'email': 'chricker@cisco.com', 'username': 'chris-ricker'}, {'_account_id': 6994, 'name': 'Michael Chapman', 'email': 'woppin@gmail.com', 'username': 'michaeltchapman'}, {'_account_id': 7155, 'name': 'Sebastien Badia', 'email': 'seb@sebian.fr', 'username': 'sbadia'}, {'_account_id': 7156, 'name': 'Mathieu Gagné', 'email': 'mgagne@calavera.ca', 'username': 'mgagne'}, {'_account_id': 7822, 'name': 'Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)', 'email': 'chris@hogepodge.com', 'username': 'hogepodge'}, {'_account_id': 9268, 'name': 'Gonéri Le Bouder', 'email': 'goneri@redhat.com', 'username': 'goneri'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-03-12 17:21:47.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'manifests/params.pp', 'spec/classes/horizon_init_spec.rb'], 'message': "ensure online cache is and can be refreshed

We use `COMPRESS_OFFLINE = True` which disable the online cache
generation. On Debian, the cache is not pre generated, unlike
Ubuntu.
The changes add be introduce in Ubuntu horizon 2012.2~rc1-0ubuntu1.

So, basicly, this changes ensure Horizon with the COMPRESS_OFFLINE=True
parameter will continue to work in this situations:
- Horizon template has been changes, python-lesscpy is required to
  regenerate the cache.
- the package doesn't provide pre-cached files (Debian), we generate the
  cache.

For the record, a issue has been opened on Debian bug tracker regard
this situation: http://bugs.debian.org/739698

See:
  I6671938a87744a4dd0b84021ca87cd49aea10741
  Ie290701b00c97352838e13182b940a6de46a591f

Change-Id: I813b5f6067bb6ecce279cab7278d9227c4d31d28
"}]
commit_message:
ensure online cache is and can be refreshed

We use `COMPRESS_OFFLINE = True` which disable the online cache
generation. On Debian, the cache is not pre generated, unlike
Ubuntu.
The changes add be introduce in Ubuntu horizon 2012.2~rc1-0ubuntu1.

So, basicly, this changes ensure Horizon with the COMPRESS_OFFLINE=True
parameter will continue to work in this situations:
- Horizon template has been changes, python-lesscpy is required to
  regenerate the cache.
- the package doesn't provide pre-cached files (Debian), we generate the
  cache.

For the record, a issue has been opened on Debian bug tracker regard
this situation: http://bugs.debian.org/739698

See:
  I6671938a87744a4dd0b84021ca87cd49aea10741
  Ie290701b00c97352838e13182b940a6de46a591f

Change-Id: I813b5f6067bb6ecce279cab7278d9227c4d31d28

commit_message:
split up stop_nova to isolate stop_nova_compute

Split stop_nova into: stop_nova_compute and stop_nova_rest. This is
needed to support the partial-ncpu grenade test where we want to stop
everything but nova_compute.

Patch in master: I6a21821277e56897d705ca5746806e2211632d12

Change-Id: I031707a49974df684cc473737ceb07cecc262c66

   time that needed for packages to be installed and time

Implements: blueprint timeout-per-datastore

commit_message:
Add timeout on prepare call per datastore

Reasons:
 - each datastore requires its own timeout due to amount of
   time that needed for packages to be installed and time
   that needed for start scripts.

Changes:
 - timeout option per datastore proposed.

Change-Id: I111e4d9384668ed341dab2d27f7795979dc2ceba
Implements: blueprint timeout-per-datastore

subject: xenapi: Fix test_rescue test to ensure assertions are valid
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 100, 'name': 'Johannes Erdfelt', 'email': 'johannes@erdfelt.com', 'username': 'johannes.erdfelt'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-11 17:25:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/xenapi/test_xenapi.py'], 'message': "xenapi: Fix test_rescue test to ensure assertions are valid

The assertion in this test gathers the list of VDI references and then
checks if the string 'swap' isn't in the list. A VDI reference is a
UUID, so the string 'swap' will never match, even if the code being
tested is buggy.

Compare against an actual VDI reference. Also, add a positive assertion
to check that the root disk from the original VM is attached.

Change-Id: I3e3e9798ce63f2f260b7993620fde3749452bfc9
Closes-bug: 1290903
"}]
commit_message:
xenapi: Fix test_rescue test to ensure assertions are valid

The assertion in this test gathers the list of VDI references and then
checks if the string 'swap' isn't in the list. A VDI reference is a
UUID, so the string 'swap' will never match, even if the code being
tested is buggy.

Compare against an actual VDI reference. Also, add a positive assertion
to check that the root disk from the original VM is attached.

Change-Id: I3e3e9798ce63f2f260b7993620fde3749452bfc9
Closes-bug: 1290903

are in no way specific to devstack as they are now.

Fixes bug 1287191

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-03-11 19:41:38.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/service.py', 'bin/cinder-volume', 'cinder/tests/test_service.py'], 'message': 'Fixes cinder-volume service startup on Windows

The Windows service fails due to missing non-blocking IO features
in eventlet. This fix adds a conditional path on Windows to execute
the service accordingly.

This bug had already been fixed by this this commit:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/44744/ but it had been reverted
here, causing the Windows service to fail again
https://review.openstack.org/67031

Fixes bug: #1219896

Change-Id: I46c6b332e614b6a84ec8372dbec3ee9fb09336de
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes cinder-volume service startup on Windows

The Windows service fails due to missing non-blocking IO features
in eventlet. This fix adds a conditional path on Windows to execute
the service accordingly.

This bug had already been fixed by this this commit:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/44744/ but it had been reverted
here, causing the Windows service to fail again
https://review.openstack.org/67031

Fixes bug: #1219896

Change-Id: I46c6b332e614b6a84ec8372dbec3ee9fb09336de

commit_message:
Use debug level logging during unit tests

When unit tests fail we need to debug, so we should have debug level logging on.
We use fixtures FakeLogger during testing, to enable debug logging pass
in log level as a parameter.

http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~python-fixtures/python-fixtures/trunk/vi
ew/head:/lib/fixtures/_fixtures/logger.py#L68

Taken from nova (Change-Id: I70790aa39c0774726de71e5fa5751c45e7e34ffd)

Change-Id: I24bcce3a9a50322f20f06670d1fe95d929aa2e72

commit_message:
identity v3 allow project list filtering by domain

The underlying keystoneclient interface allows filtering by domain,
so support it in the cli interface because it makes project list
much nicer to use in a multi-domain deployment.

Change-Id: If3f5cf1205c1e9cf314f8286a3ae81bda4456b8f
Closes-Bug: #1289513

commit_message:
Removes copy of output of 'nova help' from README

Removes the copy of the otuput of 'nova help' from the README.rst
file. It's out of date and given its not autogenerated is
rather prone to getting out of date again soon anyway. Just leave
the command that people need to run in order to print the help message.

Change-Id: I3cd069838302913bc69cc0ded5d632c7f8c3f408

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 7125, 'name': 'Alexander Ignatov', 'email': 'aignatov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aignatov'}, {'_account_id': 7213, 'name': 'Sahara Hadoop Cluster CI', 'email': 'elastic-hadoop-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'savanna-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7555, 'name': 'Matthew Farrellee', 'email': 'matt@redhat.com', 'username': 'farrellee'}, {'_account_id': 8090, 'name': 'Chad Roberts', 'email': 'croberts@redhat.com', 'username': 'croberts'}, {'_account_id': 8091, 'name': 'Trevor McKay', 'email': 'tmckay@redhat.com', 'username': 'tmckay'}, {'_account_id': 8304, 'name': 'John Speidel', 'email': 'jspeidel@hortonworks.com', 'username': 'jspeidel'}, {'_account_id': 8411, 'name': 'Andrew Lazarev', 'email': 'alazarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'alazarev'}, {'_account_id': 10670, 'name': 'Michael McCune', 'email': 'elmiko@redhat.com', 'username': 'mimccune'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-10 22:12:04.000000000', 'files': ['savanna/openstack/common/py3kcompat/urlutils.py', 'savanna/openstack/common/py3kcompat/__init__.py', 'savanna/openstack/common/service.py', 'openstack-common.conf', 'savanna/openstack/common/versionutils.py'], 'message': "Cleanup openstack-common.conf

The file contained modules from oslo-incubator that don't exist, never
existed, have graduated to oslo, are not used or are not directly used
(used only as dep for a module directly used by savanna)

With this commit the file will contain only modules that are directly
used by savanna

Also, all oslo-incubator sync'd code for unused modules has been
removed

Details -

 * config is now in oslo, need config.generator for generate_sample.sh
 * context is not used directly by savanna, used via db.sqlalchemy
 * gettextutils is not used directly by savanna, used via multiple
   other modules
 * local is not used directly by savanna, used via log
 * loopingcall is not used directly by savanna, used via threadgroup
 * py3kcompat no longer exists, it is removed
 * service is not used by savanna or any deps, it is removed
 * setup does not exist
 * thread_group does not exist
 * version does not exist
 * versionutils is not used, it is removed
 * excess comments removed

Implements: blueprint cleanup-savanna-openstack-common.conf
Change-Id: I05903a7a551b6f88b2e78c4dae2d02362aae1fbd
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup openstack-common.conf

The file contained modules from oslo-incubator that don't exist, never
existed, have graduated to oslo, are not used or are not directly used
(used only as dep for a module directly used by savanna)

With this commit the file will contain only modules that are directly
used by savanna

Also, all oslo-incubator sync'd code for unused modules has been
removed

Details -

 * config is now in oslo, need config.generator for generate_sample.sh
 * context is not used directly by savanna, used via db.sqlalchemy
 * gettextutils is not used directly by savanna, used via multiple
   other modules
 * local is not used directly by savanna, used via log
 * loopingcall is not used directly by savanna, used via threadgroup
 * py3kcompat no longer exists, it is removed
 * service is not used by savanna or any deps, it is removed
 * setup does not exist
 * thread_group does not exist
 * version does not exist
 * versionutils is not used, it is removed
 * excess comments removed

Implements: blueprint cleanup-savanna-openstack-common.conf
Change-Id: I05903a7a551b6f88b2e78c4dae2d02362aae1fbd

subject: Neutron: don't hard code the venv dir

revisions:

Updates the neutron* elements so that we use a new
NEUTRON_VENV_DIR variable (set via an environment.d hook)
to configure the installation directory for git installs.

Change-Id: Ib9bf3ba32ff4da798f5e9a776bd75c7e321fd543

commit_message:
Neutron: don't hard code the venv dir

Updates the neutron* elements so that we use a new
NEUTRON_VENV_DIR variable (set via an environment.d hook)
to configure the installation directory for git installs.

This is cleaner in that we aren't hard coding /opt/stack/venv
everywhere and also supports both isolated and shared
venvs (which some people would like to use).

Change-Id: Ib9bf3ba32ff4da798f5e9a776bd75c7e321fd543

commit_message:
Create agents table when ML2 core_plugin is used

In Icehouse agents table is not created when ml2 is used but later in
migration chain is added uniq constraint on this table. This patch makes
agents table created when ml2 plugin is used as core_plugin.

Closes-bug: 1260224
Change-Id: I501534261efd278b6a69a66758f1a01aa49bfa17

commit_message:
Restructured and updated Neutron compute section

As part of the installation guide improvement project, I performed
the following operations on the Neutron compute section:

1) Removed modularity since we will only support the ML2 plug-in
   for Icehouse.
2) Added some <procedure> tags to separate content. Future patches
   will add descriptions of each procedure.
3) Unified indentation and spacing.
4) Removed database configuration steps since Icehouse uses AMQP on
   compute nodes.
5) Removed *.ini configuration steps since Icehouse doesn't require
   editing *.ini files.
6) Moved 'auth_uri' key under [keystone_authtoken] section in
   neutron.conf.
7) Removed defunct 'auth_url' key.

This section should continue to work for installations using the Open
vSwitch plug-in for Neutron. Future patches will update the content
to use ML2.

Change-Id: I2c6207b26a8f85078ac680110d3d3244e8affd75
Partial-Bug: #1291071
Implements: blueprint networking-install-guide-improvements

commit_message:
Restructured and updated Neutron network node section

As part of the installation guide improvement project, I performed
the following operations on the Neutron network node section:

1) Removed modularity since we will only support the ML2 plug-in
   for Icehouse.
2) Added some <procedure> tags to separate content. Future patches
   will add descriptions of each procedure.
3) Unified indentation and spacing.
4) Removed *.ini configuration steps since Icehouse doesn't require
   editing *.ini files.
5) Moved 'auth_uri' key under [keystone_authtoken] section in
   neutron.conf.
6) Removed defunct reference in Neutron use cases section.

This section should continue to work for installations using the Open
vSwitch plug-in for Neutron. Future patches will update the content
to use ML2.

Change-Id: I23e0ba8df56ef3227443b5588ccb51325ec649dd
Partial-Bug: #1291071
Implements: blueprint networking-install-guide-improvements

Updates the nova* elements so that we use a new
NOVA_VENV_DIR variable (set via an environment.d hook)
to configure the virtualenv install directory.

commit_message:
Nova: don't hard code the venv dir

Updates the nova* elements so that we use a new
NOVA_VENV_DIR variable (set via an environment.d hook)
to configure the virtualenv install directory.

This is cleaner in that we aren't hard coding /opt/stack/venv
everywhere and also supports both isolated and shared
venvs (which some people would like to use).

Change-Id: I9b2ab8fd5e51b2530ec7a2b49bcc10aa369b0288

subject: Do not assert router l3 agent association
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 261, 'name': 'Salvatore Orlando', 'email': 'salv.orlando@gmail.com', 'username': 'salvatore-orlando'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4362, 'name': 'Salvatore Orlando', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-13 15:28:41.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/admin/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Do not assert router l3 agent association

Just be removing the router from an agent, we does not prevent
neutron to reschedule the router to the same agent.

Since on dvsm gate we has only one l3 agent, it is the only scheduling
choose.

Closes-Bug: #1291694
Change-Id: Idf7d184d2493fef7f6faa17f0d95c1c9f853dfb1
'}]
commit_message:
Do not assert router l3 agent association

Just be removing the router from an agent, we does not prevent
neutron to reschedule the router to the same agent.

Since on dvsm gate we has only one l3 agent, it is the only scheduling
choose.

Closes-Bug: #1291694
Change-Id: Idf7d184d2493fef7f6faa17f0d95c1c9f853dfb1

This commit adds a new function that deletes a specific
tap device. This bug fix is targeted for Havana.

	nova/network/linux_net.py

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-13 11:16:55.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/workflows/resize_instance.py'], 'message': 'Clarified success message for instance resize

Resize is an asynchronous action; the success
message can only confirm that the request for
resize was accepted by the nova API service
and that a corresponding RPC message was sent
to the nova scheduler service.

Closes-Bug: #1277257
Change-Id: I125c79c4c76fcb27f1e0d3c7122125e9036b1008
'}]
commit_message:
Clarified success message for instance resize

Resize is an asynchronous action; the success
message can only confirm that the request for
resize was accepted by the nova API service
and that a corresponding RPC message was sent
to the nova scheduler service.

Closes-Bug: #1277257
Change-Id: I125c79c4c76fcb27f1e0d3c7122125e9036b1008

token response. The server should not return disabled endpoints
in the catalog.

commit_message:
Extend network debug infos on network failures

After the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76640/ is merge tempest will
be allowed to dump the ovs db.

The ovs db dump can help in identifying trunk/access port miss configuration
issues.

subject: Improve help message in Retrieve Password form
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-13 09:41:14.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/templates/instances/_decryptpassword.html'], 'message': 'Improve help message in Retrieve Password form

A private key is used to decrypt a password.
It is better to update the message to mention "private key" explicitly
instead of "key pair". "key pair" is a pair of private and public key.

Change-Id: Icd5aa8fae2a348df011861469d028903bd71ec02
Closes-Bug: #1291529
'}]
commit_message:
Improve help message in Retrieve Password form

A private key is used to decrypt a password.
It is better to update the message to mention "private key" explicitly
instead of "key pair". "key pair" is a pair of private and public key.

Change-Id: Icd5aa8fae2a348df011861469d028903bd71ec02
Closes-Bug: #1291529

commit_message:
Validate Volume attributes of Nova POST & GET API

This patch adds the JSON schema and validate the response
of Nova POST & GET Volume APIs with JSON schema to block
the backward incompatibility change in the future.

The response body of Nova POST & GET Volume is the following:

{
    "volume": {
        "attachments": [
            {
                "device": "/",
                "id": "a26887c6-c47b-4654-abb5-dfadf7d3f803",
                "serverId": "3912f2b4-c5ba-4aec-9165-872876fe202e",
                "volumeId": "a26887c6-c47b-4654-abb5-dfadf7d3f803"
            }
        ],
        "availabilityZone": "zone1:host1",
        "createdAt": "2013-02-18T14:51:18.528085",
        "displayDescription": "Volume Description",
        "displayName": "Volume Name",
        "id": "a26887c6-c47b-4654-abb5-dfadf7d3f803",
        "metadata": {},
        "size": 100,
        "snapshotId": null,
        "status": "in-use",
        "volumeType": "Backup"
    }
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I7b98b375b87577d9bb9cf80b2fedd3b65ad0cd72

commit_message:
Set boot device to PXE when deploying

When deploying a node using the PXE driver, we set the boot device to
'pxe' (both ipminative and ipmitool understand it), and set it as persistent,
so after the deployment, the node boots using the PXE selected kernel

Change-Id: I1d25023f5a0bd46a714395367ceb2ee60a680cff
Closes-Bug: #1264596

commit_message:
Driver utils should raise unsupported method

Instead of raising InvalidParameterValue when an unsupported vendor
extension is called, this patch causes the driver utils to raise
UnsupportedDriverExtension.

Change-Id: Id297639e67f444164b093c3f1f9731995319599f

commit_message:
SeaMicro use device parameter for set_boot_device

To have consistency between the different drivers, we modify
SeaMicro to make use of the 'device' parameter instead of
'boot_device', as the other drivers are using, for the set_boot_device
vendorpassthru.

Change-Id: Id7e07924c4c028013db29566952d8dbd317a9f2c

commit_message:
Stop editing config.json.

Now that the t-i-e element supports reading local.json in preference
to config.json, we can put our edited state in local.json and avoid
dirtying the git tree.

commit_message:

This fixes an issue where copy.deepcopy was being a called
on an ImmutableLocations object, causing a Forbidden to be
raised.

Closes-Bug: 1287888

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-03-13 10:34:56.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py'], 'message': "Make the Nova Ironic driver to wait for ACTIVE

After returning from spawn() Nova will set the status of the instance
to ACTIVE, but that's wrong because Ironic does the deploy in an async
fashion. So this patch makes the Nova spawn() method to wait for the
Node being provision by Ironic to be on the ACTIVE (or DEPLOYFAIL)
state before returning.

Change-Id: I057a6e2e9fc6f4c85b7b2b9c63f541248b1214ac
"}]
commit_message:
Make the Nova Ironic driver to wait for ACTIVE

After returning from spawn() Nova will set the status of the instance
to ACTIVE, but that's wrong because Ironic does the deploy in an async
fashion. So this patch makes the Nova spawn() method to wait for the
Node being provision by Ironic to be on the ACTIVE (or DEPLOYFAIL)
state before returning.

Change-Id: I057a6e2e9fc6f4c85b7b2b9c63f541248b1214ac

commit_message:
Move load_user_creds out of StackWatch

This method was moved out of EngineService in a recent refactor
however load_user_creds not related to stack watching, so this
method is better off living in EngineService.

subject: WIP Add Object Version Registry WIP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-27 18:21:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/registry.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_registry.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/229_add_object_version_tracking.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py'], 'message': "WIP Add Object Version Registry WIP

This adds an object version registry, which we will be able to use
to track which version of an object each host/service has during
an upgrade phase. This is needed so that, for example, the nova-api
service can properly backlevel objects before it sends them to
older compute nodes.

A new table (object_versions) is added, which stores object names
and versions for each host/service. Instead of storing every version
of every object for every service, it only stores those that are
older than the conductor node's objects. So, if everything is running
the same level of code, (basically) nothing will be stored in this
table. When a conductor is upgraded, it will be able to start
storing object version deltas.

The expectation is that compute nodes will report their object
versions very rarely, perhaps only once per invocation.

NOTE: This new object isn't a direct mapping to the sqlalchemy
model. Also, since we've been talking about doing away with db/api,
I thought I would try creating this one with native code inside,
instead of synthesizing new db/api methods for it, just to see/show
what it will be like. I can add db/api methods if desirable.

TODO:
 - Conductor needs to store its versions in the database
 - Conductor needs to realize that if its records are older
   than its own versions that computes without records are old
 - Probably need one persistent record per compute as a marker

Change-Id: Iaa613a1691d592129af2602dff90155bc2ed22a5
"}]
commit_message:
WIP Add Object Version Registry WIP

This adds an object version registry, which we will be able to use
to track which version of an object each host/service has during
an upgrade phase. This is needed so that, for example, the nova-api
service can properly backlevel objects before it sends them to
older compute nodes.

A new table (object_versions) is added, which stores object names
and versions for each host/service. Instead of storing every version
of every object for every service, it only stores those that are
older than the conductor node's objects. So, if everything is running
the same level of code, (basically) nothing will be stored in this
table. When a conductor is upgraded, it will be able to start
storing object version deltas.

The expectation is that compute nodes will report their object
versions very rarely, perhaps only once per invocation.

NOTE: This new object isn't a direct mapping to the sqlalchemy
model. Also, since we've been talking about doing away with db/api,
I thought I would try creating this one with native code inside,
instead of synthesizing new db/api methods for it, just to see/show
what it will be like. I can add db/api methods if desirable.

TODO:
 - Conductor needs to store its versions in the database
 - Conductor needs to realize that if its records are older
   than its own versions that computes without records are old
 - Probably need one persistent record per compute as a marker

Change-Id: Iaa613a1691d592129af2602dff90155bc2ed22a5

Check whether all the groups issued by the RuleProcessor are present in

commit_message:
Enforce groups presence for federated authn

Check whether all the groups issued by the RuleProcessor are present in
the backend. The request is rejected with an authentication error if no
groups are issued. If any of the issued groups are not found in the
backend, an unexpected error (500) is returned with a message explaining
which group was not found. Also, this policy is applied when an unscoped
token is being scoped.

Change-Id: I8b843fc567892289fba4c04b7e8b1dfd63d1e9ca
Closes-bug: #1290258

commit_message:
vmware: Mark VMware ESX vmdk driver as deprecated

The VMware ESX driver in Nova is now marked as deprecated and will be
removed in Juno release. This change marks the VMware ESX vmdk driver
as deprecated since it is intended for use with the ESX driver in Nova.
The plan is to remove the ESX vmdk driver in Juno release.

Closes-Bug: #1291194
DocImpact
Change-Id: I285f3461c1ccef56329b70417fb023405dfceb5e

subject: Fix 'spacing' parameters for periodic tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-13 14:29:07.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': "Fix 'spacing' parameters for periodic tasks

conductor.manager module contains 'spacing' parameters for periodic
tasks, they do not work because manager module imported before
parsing config options. Oslo code uses metaclass for collect
periodical tasks with options, therefore add periodical tasks
options lazyly not possible via periodic_task decorator. This
patch uses _periodic_spacing attribute of base class.

Partial-Bug: #1279774
Change-Id: Ia6f60ddc00cc3f6f57925ddade5a46dcebaca852
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 'spacing' parameters for periodic tasks

conductor.manager module contains 'spacing' parameters for periodic
tasks, they do not work because manager module imported before
parsing config options. Oslo code uses metaclass for collect
periodical tasks with options, therefore add periodical tasks
options lazyly not possible via periodic_task decorator. This
patch uses _periodic_spacing attribute of base class.

Partial-Bug: #1279774
Change-Id: Ia6f60ddc00cc3f6f57925ddade5a46dcebaca852

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary sorting from search

The existing sort was only applied to some result sets.  Instead
of sorting all sets, I don't think any sorting is needed at this
level of code.  Consumers of these methods can choose to sort if
really needed.

Closes bug: 1289441

Change-Id: I0bba67b0ae23f513c27fb67265686704a1000769

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-05 17:35:24.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/mysql-server.rb', 'spec/mysql-server-redhat_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Use InnoDB for mysql on redhat

The default for mysql 5.5 is InnoDB. Ubuntu and SuSE use 5.5, but
Rehdat uses 5.1 with default of myISAM. Openstack core projets
require InnoDB. Some of core projects do not handle setting the
engine properly when creating tables.
Bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1288358,
The mysql cookbook also does not allow this to be overridden
(https://tickets.opscode.com/browse/COOK-4370).
This patch is a workaround until those bugs are fixed.

Change-Id: I0bd2ed5ffb97a979551a68df5d6bbc2f533fcd57
'}]
commit_message:
Use InnoDB for mysql on redhat

The default for mysql 5.5 is InnoDB. Ubuntu and SuSE use 5.5, but
Rehdat uses 5.1 with default of myISAM. Openstack core projets
require InnoDB. Some of core projects do not handle setting the
engine properly when creating tables.
Bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1288358,
The mysql cookbook also does not allow this to be overridden
(https://tickets.opscode.com/browse/COOK-4370).
This patch is a workaround until those bugs are fixed.

Change-Id: I0bd2ed5ffb97a979551a68df5d6bbc2f533fcd57

commit_message:
98-source-repositories tries to return from script

In 8b2325118ff8d3334d51d86d293962acc8dd0962 we added a line
so that 98-source-repositories tries to return from the top
level script (not from within a function).

Also, remove the return 1 within the function as well
because we just want to continue in these cases.

Change-Id: I66eddc12208b278594a0a8d8676c38d72045ca75

commit_message:
Add admin_metadata 'protected' for volume

Aim to enhance the protect for the volume to avoid delete by mistake.
The volume can't be deleted until the 'protected' is setted to 'False'.
An exception is the volume is deleted by force.

Partly-Implements: blueprint protected-volume
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/protected-volume

Change-Id: I33489abe7b9846103e8b158266ec868e6a969530

subject: Provide an upgrade period for enabling stores
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 616, 'name': 'Mark Washenberger', 'email': 'mark.washenberger@markwash.net', 'username': 'markwash'}, {'_account_id': 1706, 'name': 'Tom Hancock', 'email': 'tom.hancock@hp.com', 'username': 'tom-hancock'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6484, 'name': 'Feilong Wang', 'email': 'hustemb@gmail.com', 'username': 'flwang'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 6493, 'name': 'John Bresnahan', 'email': 'john@bresnahan.me', 'username': 'jbresnah'}, {'_account_id': 6549, 'name': 'Zhi Yan Liu', 'email': 'lzy.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'lzy-dev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-03-12 16:50:21.000000000', 'files': ['glance/store/__init__.py', 'glance/tests/functional/store/__init__.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_store_base.py'], 'message': "Provide an upgrade period for enabling stores

1f6381a73f5c99f1f731d6c4f9defb91bd2d042d disabled all stores by default,
this casues upgrade issues for CD environments and folks that are not
aware of the change. This patch adds a way to attempt enabling the store
if its configuration parameters were set. If the store fails to load and
it's not in `known_stores` then no error will be reported.

The patch also warns the user when a store succeeds to load but it was
not explicitly enabled in `known_stores`. Note that there may be false
positives since some stores may not require any configuration parameter.

Change-Id: Ie784fe90003a5064aaf16fadb7266bf7a46e2cf5
Closes-Bug: #1290969
"}]
commit_message:
Provide an upgrade period for enabling stores

1f6381a73f5c99f1f731d6c4f9defb91bd2d042d disabled all stores by default,
this casues upgrade issues for CD environments and folks that are not
aware of the change. This patch adds a way to attempt enabling the store
if its configuration parameters were set. If the store fails to load and
it's not in `known_stores` then no error will be reported.

The patch also warns the user when a store succeeds to load but it was
not explicitly enabled in `known_stores`. Note that there may be false
positives since some stores may not require any configuration parameter.

Change-Id: Ie784fe90003a5064aaf16fadb7266bf7a46e2cf5
Closes-Bug: #1290969

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-03-13 07:43:31.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/config/generator.py', 'setup.cfg', 'tests/unit/config/broken_opts_lib.py', 'tests/unit/config/test_generator.py'], 'message': 'Re-raise exception of unloadable library

The patch re-raises the exception when a stevedore extention fails to
load.

Before this patch, the config generator silently ignore options
from a library (-l) when the oslo.config.opts entry point of the
library fail to load, and result to an incomplete configuration file.

Closes bug #1287789

Change-Id: I58ce4f0b0c422c558f2465fb008ce72b7dffc50f
'}]
commit_message:
Re-raise exception of unloadable library

The patch re-raises the exception when a stevedore extention fails to
load.

Before this patch, the config generator silently ignore options
from a library (-l) when the oslo.config.opts entry point of the
library fail to load, and result to an incomplete configuration file.

Closes bug #1287789

Change-Id: I58ce4f0b0c422c558f2465fb008ce72b7dffc50f

commit_message:
Cleanup backends after each test

Instance variables lingering around after a test completes can waste a
significant amount of memory during a long test run. This commit adds a
general helper method that can be used by add test classes to clean up
instance variables.

Change-Id: Ie7554f4c2e6e80540ea9f393f29b0eb15cacdf8c

commit_message:
Fix InvalidInstanceID.NotFound handling

The matcher used with boto tests is returing with None,
 when it matches. The incorrect condition handling may lead to
longer deletion time or failure.

Change-Id: I7d03528ab6183dd9a49169c0a6ec2a4a95fb7d52

As git repositories are copied into the image make a note of their

This allows the code used in building an image to be found after

Change-Id: I7dbe9e163ad38a418cf2869a81e720de2c27dfb1

commit_message:
Create a git manifest from source-repositories

As git repositories are copied into the image make a note of their
details and add them to a manifest on the build system.

This allows the code used in building an image to be found after
the image build is completed without needing to open the image up
for inspection.

Change-Id: I7dbe9e163ad38a418cf2869a81e720de2c27dfb1

commit_message:
Implement new object-model specification

 * Implemented new object model
 * Implemented spec validation
 * Old DSL parser was deleted
 * All code is replaced by new workbook spec
 * Also tests are fixed
 * events -> triggers
 * Unit tests

Implements: blueprint mistral-dsl-model
Partially implements: blueprint mistral-dsl-validation
Partially implements: blueprint mistral-rename-event-to-trigger

Change-Id: I782b7983ddc724375229587f467c55ad9341478b

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 532, 'name': 'Philip Marc Schwartz', 'email': 'philip@progmad.com', 'username': 'philip-schwartz'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-03-12 13:51:38.000000000', 'files': ['elements/ceilometer/install.d/68-ceilometer', 'elements/neutron/install.d/neutron-source-install/76-neutron', 'elements/tuskar/install.d/100-tuskar-api', 'elements/ironic/install.d/68-ironic', 'elements/boot-stack/bin/reset-db'], 'message': 'Link db sync utilities to /usr/local/bin...

Updates the ceilometer, ironic, neutron, and tuskar elements
so that we soft link the DB sync utilities into /usr/local/bin.

This allows us to refactor the reset-db script to avoid hard
coding the /opt/stack/venv binary patch which is used for
source installs.

This is cleaner and makes things consistent. It also makes
the source installs consistent with how most distro packages
work (thus making reset-db useful with packages as well).

Change-Id: Ib8c36811230512e4283f3f960254b2c37e699f46
'}]
commit_message:
Link db sync utilities to /usr/local/bin...

Updates the ceilometer, ironic, neutron, and tuskar elements
so that we soft link the DB sync utilities into /usr/local/bin.

This allows us to refactor the reset-db script to avoid hard
coding the /opt/stack/venv binary patch which is used for
source installs.

This is cleaner and makes things consistent. It also makes
the source installs consistent with how most distro packages
work (thus making reset-db useful with packages as well).

Change-Id: Ib8c36811230512e4283f3f960254b2c37e699f46

With this change - remove 'id' from the list of valid keys and ensure

commit_message:
Ensure that request body in v2 contains valid fields

Currently 'id' and other fields like 'created_at' and 'updated_at' can
be set in the request body.  Some of these fields are ignored and
some like 'id' can actual set the id.
With this change - remove 'id' from the list of valid keys and ensure
that only valid keys are present in the request body.
Closes-Bug: #1291518

Change-Id: I99f3f106c0004fa5521869e46da85f1053241eb5

commit_message:
VMware: raise an exception for unsupported disk formats

At the moment 'vmdk' and 'iso' are the only disk formats supported.
If an invalid format is passed with the image then the driver will
throw and exception.

Change-Id: I834856f33a0644bc03b89a2b98e4e188c112e338
Closes-bug: #1287844

commit_message:
Order imports in alphabetical order (6/9)

This patch is one in a series to re-enable H306 style check rule
(imports are in alphabetical order). It touches engine resources files.

Implements: blueprint reduce-flake8-ignored-rules (partial)

subject: Require that root runs image manipulation scripts
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-11 15:27:55.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create', 'bin/disk-image-get-kernel'], 'message': 'Require that root runs image manipulation scripts

If a non-root user is used to build images then there may be a
number of user-owned files left in the built image, which is
undesirable.

This also removes the requirement that elements use sudo for
varying operations depending on what is executing, making for
easier development of elements.

Change-Id: Idc7c0e160f46703d85cafa664f1294b4c48490a6
'}]
commit_message:
Require that root runs image manipulation scripts

If a non-root user is used to build images then there may be a
number of user-owned files left in the built image, which is
undesirable.

This also removes the requirement that elements use sudo for
varying operations depending on what is executing, making for
easier development of elements.

Change-Id: Idc7c0e160f46703d85cafa664f1294b4c48490a6

commit_message:
Use oslo.messaging

* Remove muranoapi/openstack/common/rpc
* Remove muranoapi/openstack/common/notifier
* Add ResultEndpoint for handling results from Conductor
* Add ReportNotificationEndpoint for handling reports from Conductor
* Add ConductorClient to send environments to Conductor
* Update murano-api.conf.sample with new RabbitMQ settings
* Clean-up openstack-common from rpc/notifier modules

Change-Id: I4b63f3e2b848143af99dff3c7d39080cc39516a0

commit_message:
Add support for Django 1.6

The django.conf.urls.defaults module has been removed in Django 1.6.
The functions include(), patterns() and url() plus handler404, handler500,
are now available through django.conf.urls.

https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/internals/deprecation/

Closes-Bug: #1291953

Change-Id: I35e0dcd44ce92cefdcedcc7d24472cef8f53454c

commit_message:
Renaming all Savanna references to Sahara

WARNING:
----
Before merging this commit the alias for
http://sahara-files.mirantis.com needs to be in place.

Also before merging this commit the new openstack git project must be
available at https://git.openstack.org/openstack/sahara-image-elements/

NOTE:
----
The file 'elements/hadoop-hdp/source-repository-hadoopswift' contains a
link to the HortonWorks repository that holds the Hadoop Swift rpm, this
link needs to be updated when HortonWorks makes the change.

Implements: blueprint savanna-renaming-image-elements
Change-Id: Icb9a992f8545535af3a111580ce7c9622d754c67

commit_message:
Set the database.connection option default value

This was previously set right before ironic-api start, but the
default value must also be present for ironic-dbsync calls.

Note: the default value of database.connection is changed here - from
now on the sqlite database will be stored in ./ironic/ironic.sqlite
instead of ./ironic/openstack/common/db/ironic.sqlite.

Closes-Bug: #1290645

Change-Id: I2c2ab2f10a99ffd564611351e71c0b88adc20ba7

commit_message:
disable /var/lib/glance partition

In case of using ceph-osd as image storage,
dont send /var/lib/glance partition to provisioner
and set max_image_cache_size to 0 in such case

Change-Id: I337c7e3d7f6079a2999592729c9db355a13ed406
Closes-Bug: #1262312

commit_message:
Update editable attributes partially

If we receive from PUT smth like:
{"editable": {"storage": {"osd_pool_size": {"value": 3},
"volumes_ceph": {"value": true}}}}

attributes.editable will contain only received data and no default one

Changing paste.TestApp for webtest.TestApp cause TestApp does not have
PATCH method available

Change-Id: I259ee806c9464cb82b391e9c3b633e5e7f5f11d3
Closes-Bug: #1283135

commit_message:
Adds NFS backend support for cinder-volume

This patch installs nfs-utils, creates a directory for mounting
shares, adds configuration and sets up the shares file if
metadata keys "include_nfs_backend: true" and "nfs_shares" are
present.

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/75017/ for template info.

Change-Id: Id29015e6b2a97ee8a13049eb7d9161781b415be4

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-07 13:31:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/rpc/agentnotifiers/dhcp_rpc_agent_api.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/agentnotifiers/test_dhcp_rpc_agent_api.py'], 'message': 'Lower log level of no dhcp-agent association

No dhcp-agent association for a network was logged as ERROR level.
However it is completely incorrect for network_create_end, and
usually wrong for subnet_create_end (because a subnet is created
just after a network is created in most cases).
This commit removes logging for these cases.

For other cases, a dhcp-agent is usually associated with a network,
and no dhcp-agent assocation might be a symptom of some error.
On the other hand there are valid cases where no dhcp-agent is
associated (e.g., delete dhcp-agent association intentionally,
network/subnet_update_end before a port is created).
Considering these and the fact that error will be logged in
dhcp-agent scheduler, it is logged as INFO level now.

Closes-Bug: #1289130
Change-Id: Icefc13cb4c8cf4be1143ec5377b94b3dc39e1bd4
'}]
commit_message:
Lower log level of no dhcp-agent association

No dhcp-agent association for a network was logged as ERROR level.
However it is completely incorrect for network_create_end, and
usually wrong for subnet_create_end (because a subnet is created
just after a network is created in most cases).
This commit removes logging for these cases.

For other cases, a dhcp-agent is usually associated with a network,
and no dhcp-agent assocation might be a symptom of some error.
On the other hand there are valid cases where no dhcp-agent is
associated (e.g., delete dhcp-agent association intentionally,
network/subnet_update_end before a port is created).
Considering these and the fact that error will be logged in
dhcp-agent scheduler, it is logged as INFO level now.

Closes-Bug: #1289130
Change-Id: Icefc13cb4c8cf4be1143ec5377b94b3dc39e1bd4

Show atomic operations results without aggregation with CLI

This patch adds support to show atomic operations results without
aggregation with CLI
group with CLI. e.g.
$ rally task detailed last --no-aggregation

Change-Id: Ia19b49cffff4bc86a0effbcb569b262a0f154956

cinder/context.py just like nova/context.py uses a custom context
which is populating user and tenant in the to_dict method, so the
log format has to match what's available in the context.

commit_message:
log format does not have access to user_identity

cinder/context.py just like nova/context.py uses a custom context
which is populating user and tenant in the to_dict method, so the
log format has to match what's available in the context.

Closes-Bug: #1290503
Change-Id: Iec1cb6b57cc9dd0d8c56c18d1e646818300c8097
