revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-05 14:31:54.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/neutron/files/q-agent-cleanup.py'], 'message': 'Make Neutron L3/DHCP agents OCF script more tolerant to mysql and keystone temporary fails.

In this implementation cleanup-script does not get information from Neutron API.
Script inspects network namespaces on this node for given agent type and removes
found ports from integration bridge.

Closes-bug: #1287716
Partial-bug: #1285929
Change-Id: I2dfb31f240dca652341c4623f237f6a143414448
'}]
commit_message:
Make Neutron L3/DHCP agents OCF script more tolerant to mysql and keystone temporary fails.

In this implementation cleanup-script does not get information from Neutron API.
Script inspects network namespaces on this node for given agent type and removes
found ports from integration bridge.

Closes-bug: #1287716
Partial-bug: #1285929
Change-Id: I2dfb31f240dca652341c4623f237f6a143414448

commit_message:
Check validity of remote_ip_prefix

it should check validity of 'remote_ip_prefix' in
'security-group-rule-create', the 'remote_ip_prefix' should be a valid
CIDR.

commit_message:
Change API v1 path to explicit module

In order to prepare API v2, we need to isolate API v1 code into a
separate module called climate.api.v1

Implements blueprint: pecan-wsme

Change-Id: I9e968370ba9ac8d21f5c099f1b09587d9f6b821e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-12 20:05:43.000000000', 'files': ['rally/sshutils.py'], 'message': 'Capture the pkey errors

Instead of just dropping the pkey errors capture the
errors and include those errors in the final exception

actual error happened.

Change-Id: I6423225a85147377d426bc086878a96b3e354f01
'}]
commit_message:
Capture the pkey errors

Instead of just dropping the pkey errors capture the
errors and include those errors in the final exception
that may be thrown.

This helps make it easier to understand why the
actual error happened.

Change-Id: I6423225a85147377d426bc086878a96b3e354f01

commit_message:
Make linux_net use objects for last fixed ip query

This converts the final uses of direct database calls from the
linux_net module by utilizing the calls just added to the
FixedIP object.

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

Related-bug: 1290568
Change-Id: I58828e9112e43967fe8daa070575ca122041690a

subject: Fix mysql-server ignoring root_user_use_databag attribute.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-12 22:56:28.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/mysql-server.rb'], 'message': "Fix mysql-server ignoring root_user_use_databag attribute.

Addresses: bug #1273353

The mysql-server recipe was not checking the
default['openstack']['db']['root_user_use_databag'] attribute to see if
it should use the node['mysql']['server_root_password'] attribute or
check a databag for the mysql root password.

Change-Id: I589f7e43fc1f15c072d3e50dab6cef25f367075b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix mysql-server ignoring root_user_use_databag attribute.

Addresses: bug #1273353

The mysql-server recipe was not checking the
default['openstack']['db']['root_user_use_databag'] attribute to see if
it should use the node['mysql']['server_root_password'] attribute or
check a databag for the mysql root password.

Change-Id: I589f7e43fc1f15c072d3e50dab6cef25f367075b

subject: Fix ring-builder crash
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-11 18:29:22.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/ring/builder.py', 'test/unit/common/ring/test_builder.py'], 'message': 'Fix ring-builder crash

If you had a partition with 1 replica on a deleted device, 1 on a
zero-weight device, and 1 on a normal device, then rebalancing would
crash. This was because the ring builder was memoizing tiers_for_dev()
for all *available* devices (i.e. weight > 0 and not deleted), but
depended on it being present for all devices with partitions still on
them.

Since the builder moved the replica from the deleted device, it left
the one on the zero-weight device alone, so you had an unavailable
device with a partition replica still on it, triggering the crash.

Now we go ahead and memoize tiers_for_dev() for *all* devices, not
just available ones, thereby fixing the crash.

Change-Id: Ie0b58b65e0353732cf785ab772e95e699f3a5b5d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ring-builder crash

If you had a partition with 1 replica on a deleted device, 1 on a
zero-weight device, and 1 on a normal device, then rebalancing would
crash. This was because the ring builder was memoizing tiers_for_dev()
for all *available* devices (i.e. weight > 0 and not deleted), but
depended on it being present for all devices with partitions still on
them.

Since the builder moved the replica from the deleted device, it left
the one on the zero-weight device alone, so you had an unavailable
device with a partition replica still on it, triggering the crash.

Now we go ahead and memoize tiers_for_dev() for *all* devices, not
just available ones, thereby fixing the crash.

Change-Id: Ie0b58b65e0353732cf785ab772e95e699f3a5b5d

commit_message:
Send mcollective logs to syslog as well

- Use rsyslog::imfile to track mco logs as syslog daemon/debug ones
- Drop duplicating mco/nailgun-agent messages targeted to syslog files
- Add nailgun-agent.log to log rotation plans as well.

Partial blueprint: collect-mco-and-agent-logs-with-shotgun

Change-Id: I95c6e04bd1f647ea655647223bffffe9b4e7a8a8
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Developer documentation

* Turns TESTING into a rst file, that we include in the developer
  documentation, for instructions on how to run the unit tests.
* Link to a Vagrant project that sets up Neutron inside a VM.
* Adds a section for how to debug with Nose
* Add new section for Neutron Internals
* Neutron L2 Agent documentation - currently only OVS
* Make the Security Group API extension an example of how an API
  extension is implemented

Implements bp developer-documentation

Change-Id: I9b452abc9da3b1a41ae65cff727967de0eab12fe

commit_message:
Remove vi modelines

We don't need to have the vi modelines in each source file,
it can be set in a user's vimrc if required.

Change-Id: Ib8f05652ff863da47d2e01b3a3fa5f4f3a15921d
Closes-Bug: #1229324

commit_message:
Changing "Savanna" to "Sahara" in basic strings

Changing "Savanna" to "Sahara" in basic strings as part of the
project renaming effort.  The strings changed here are mostly
of the most basic nature and mostly affect only displayed text.

Partial-Implements: blueprint savanna-renaming-dashboard

Change-Id: Ifdbff723894a2b6fb98e95e1f1595f6712ad662a

commit_message:
Renaming savannadashboard directory to saharadashboard

* Renaming savannadashboard directory to saharadashboard which
also includes updating all of the places where that package
is referenced.
* Also including some renaming in the documentation.
* Changing the name of the top level panel to Sahara
* Changing the name of the top level Dashboard class to SaharaDashboard

Partial-Implements: blueprint savanna-renaming-dashboard

Change-Id: If51b85d22ec7798c214c56189359260198e69374

commit_message:
Add ability to set key value pairs in projects

Add supporto of extra key value pairs for projects (aka tenants)
* Added option --property key=value to create and set commands
* Support for versions v2 and v3

Change-Id: I84064b8b308579d1b66c83b1ed3d1a37614ec087
Closes-Bug: #1220280

commit_message:
Remove conductor compute_node methods

This removes compute_node_create() and compute_node_update() from the
conductor RPCAPI and API. They are no longer used because of the
conversion to objects.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: I9b3b5ca6f810576231d4e705039a3df961c82fa0

commit_message:
Complete object conversion for get_rdp_console()

The get_rdp_console() method in the compute manager takes an Instance object, so
convert it to attribute-style access.  The virt driver method takes the Instance
object, so fix the base virt drivers test for this method to use the Instance
object, too.

Part of blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: I4ae5aabc85e3763fdfd1a245c8fd01015b1f61b0

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-03-03 01:49:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/objects/test_objects.py'], 'message': "Add skipping in compare_obj() not to compare those fields

Add skipping list in compare_obj() in order not to compare those fields
when comparing an object to a db dict. Its default value is [].

Because some of fields in an object can be construtured into other objects,
We will call compare_obj() again to compare them. So those fields don't
need to be compared in this call. We give a chance to skip those fields
this time.

Related to blueprint icehouse-objects.

Change-Id: I21d214b8e181c5bba2a74084bea9f85917269a14
"}]
commit_message:
Add skipping in compare_obj() not to compare those fields

Add skipping list in compare_obj() in order not to compare those fields
when comparing an object to a db dict. Its default value is [].

Because some of fields in an object can be construtured into other objects,
We will call compare_obj() again to compare them. So those fields don't
need to be compared in this call. We give a chance to skip those fields
this time.

Related to blueprint icehouse-objects.

commit_message:
Removed copyright from empty files

According to policy change in HACKING:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing
empty files should no longer contain copyright notices.
Please note only changes to oslo (neutron/openstack/common/) included!

Change-Id: I0569ffffa3ddeb8c087f2d4045287a44743fd505
Closes-Bug: #1262424

commit_message:
Extends V2 servers api for pci support

All pci passthrough code is merged into nova, but the APIs are not
supported. This patch extends the servers to show PCI information for
instance and compute node.

Because of the bug 1270680, we need to synchronize the code to V2
servers API.
Change Id3c8a0b1: Join pci_devices when getting all servers in API
Change Id3e60c3c: Join pci_devices for servers API

This function has been merged in V3 API, synchronize this to the V2 API.

Partially implement blueprint pci-api-support

Change-Id: I81ccc8c84aab0361a0cece10e67f887844a6340c

commit_message:
Extends V2 os-hypervisor api for pci support

All pci passthrough code is merged into nova, but the APIs are not
supported. This patch extends os-hypervisor to show PCI information for
instance and compute node.

This function has been merged in V3 API, synchronize it to the V2 API.

Partially implement blueprint pci-api-support

Change-Id: Ic6d10121a4ae40fbaca7e1f9f6fae4df0e5fad61

commit_message:
Add V2 api for pci support

All pci passthrough code is merged into nova, but the API does not support.
this patch provides a resource: endpoint to show PCI infomation.

Partially implement blueprint pci-api-support

Change-Id: I607418f64239e66a10b1ffd51be4149a9bce9dd3

commit_message:
Add find host logic on rebuild_instance.

In the event of an unrecoverable hardware failure, support needs to
relocate an instance to another compute so it can be rebuilt.

  [*] Add logic required to support rebuild without host.
      (used by evacuate)

Partial Implements: blueprint find-host-and-evacuate-instance

Co-Authored-By: Juan M. Olle <juan.m.olle@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Anuj Mathur <anujm@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Navneet Kumar <navneetk@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Claxton Correya <claxton@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Iecf627a136eb0a6b3576860808eb2e0f2bbcbb9e

commit_message:
Add APIv2 support to make host optional on evacuate.

In the event of an unrecoverable hardware failure, support needs to
relocate an instance to another compute so it can be rebuilt.

The changes involved in this patch are:
  [*] Add a new v2 extension to determine that the host argument
      on evacuate is now optional.(Extended_evacuate_find_host)
  [*] Doc regeneration.

DocImpact: The evacuate target host is now optional. If
'host' field is not sent in the request, the scheduler
will determine the target host. This will include
nova client changes ( on the proper commit ) to support
this new optional parameter.

Implements: blueprint find-host-and-evacuate-instance

Co-Authored-By: Juan M. Olle <juan.m.olle@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andres Buraschi <andres.buraschi@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Anuj Mathur <anujm@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Navneet Kumar <navneetk@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Claxton Correya <claxton@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I1bc40d62c66f1c7a9d39660a4fdffccd7e48d287
